events.name: Celebrating Earth Day: Nature in the city
events.description_html: With fewer people and cars around it's getting easier to see the natural world around us. For this Earth Day, make a sketch to appreciate what you can see close to home. It doesn't need to be wilderness—city parks and gardens are full of wonder. No garden nearby? Make a study of the birds on the telephone wires outside your window (I saw my first Mockingbird of the season a few days ago) or the weeds coming up through the sidewalk. But, as always, make it about something you can see in this time, this place.

events.name: Are you having trouble controlling the way you eat?
events.organiser: by Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous (FA)
events.summary: Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous (FA) is a free Twelve Step recovery program for anyone suffering from food obsession, overeating, unde
events.description_html:
Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous (FA) is a free Twelve Step recovery program for anyone suffering from food obsession, overeating, under-eating or bulimia. Meetings are held Fridays at Salvation Army Welfare Centre, 100 Boyce Road, Maroubra at 10:00am. For more information or a list of additional meetings throughout Australia and the world, visit: www.foodaddicts.org.


ABOUT FOOD ADDICTS IN RECOVERY ANONYMOUS

Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous is a 12 Step fellowship based on the principles of Alcoholics Anonymous (AA). FA is a tax-exempt, non-profit Twelve Step program that helps people of all ages who have issues with food. There are no dues or fees for members. Anyone, from any walk of life, who seeks recovery from their problems with food, is welcome. 


The following meeting is held in Sydney every week:

Fridays - 10:00 am - 11:30 am

Salvation Army Welfare Centre

100 Boyce Road, Maroubra, NSW 2035

events.name: ONLINE : Healthy body and mind naturally - workshop
events.summary:
PLEASE NOTE THIS EVENT IS HELD IN SUTHERLAND SHIRE 
In our increasingly busy and demanding work environment poor mental health and wellbeing
events.description_html:
PLEASE NOTE THIS EVENT IS HELD IN SUTHERLAND SHIRE 

In our increasingly busy and demanding work environment poor mental health and wellbeing continue to see high stress levels and be a challenge for people in our industry and beyond.

I used to be in the digital industry environment, working hard and playing hard. It took a toll, of course it did. Until I couldn't ignore the signs my body was giving me to slow down and take a hard look at my lifestyle. 

This became my passion to help others to slow down and offer tools such as essential oils to help with stress, anxiety, energy, poor immune system and lack of focus and much more. 

Come and join me to chat about how essential oils can help and improve: 

  1. Emotional wellbeing 
  2. Physical health - immunity, energy, sleep, exercise 
  3. Green cleaning - removing toxins from your home 

Check out my website https://dropofthat.com/ 

Follow me https://www.instagram.com/drop_of_that/

events.name: Agile Business Analyst (ABA) - Virtual Training, 24 April 2020 (AxisAgile)
events.summary:
To find out more about our company, view AxisAgile's Web Page
 
The role of Business Analyst (BA) changes in the Agile world.  Stay ahead
events.description_html:
To find out more about our company, view AxisAgile's Web Page

 

The role of Business Analyst (BA) changes in the Agile world.  Stay ahead with new techniqus, tools and tactics to guide your Agile team and support your Product Owner.

Our Agile BA course is an engaging 1-day session designed to provide Business Analysts with the knowledge and techniques to optimise the delivery of requirements, ensure that teams build relevant products and assist Product Owners manage the demands of complex initiatives.

Based on the Agile Extension to the BABOK guide, this course builds its foundation on the industry's best practices.

 

Our virtual course (laptop or desktop with Internet connection required) includes:

  • downloadable training materials;
  • real-time instruction; relatable examples;
  • AND the option to attend the same training course in-person at a later date at no additional cost

 

 

What is included in each course?

 

A copy of Scrum Shortcuts Without Cutting Corners

When attending our in-person session, you get a copy of Scrum Shortcuts Without Cutting Corners, the hugely popular book that was selected to be part of the 'Mike Cohn Agile Signature Series' (the premiere book series on Scrum and Agile globally). This book is full of great Agile tactics, tips and tricks that many have found to be invaluable. But don't take our word for it, check out the reviews on Amazon! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We're here to support you!

Don't worry, when you've concluded your training with us, we're still here to help via our free ongoing support. Email us with a question and we're sure to reply. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

USB pen with all electronic materials for each attendee

USB pens with the electronic course materials will be provided at the in-person session to help your team members focus on their training and re-enforce their knowledge after the course.

 


 


 

 

 

 

Workbooks to help you connect with the course

As well as an electronic copy of all of the slides and other materials, on the day of the in-person course you will receive a fill-in-the-gaps, workbook to use and follow along with during the course. This has been specifically designed to help reinforce key learnings.


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A sleek laptop case to keep it all together

Not only do we provide you with a whole host of great merchandise, but at the in-person course, we also ensure that you have an efficient way to take it all home with you via the neat laptop bag that you will also receive. You’re welcome!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This course covers 

  • Traditional vs Agile requirement analysis - Learn how the role of the Business Analyst changes
  • Agile Extension to the BABOK guide - Understand the three horizons and seven principles
  • User Story Mapping - See the whole, while gathering detail on what is most important
  • Where Business Analysts fit in - Understand how a BA fits within a cross-functional delivery team
  • Refining requirements collaboratively - Empathise with the customer, and observe requirements through their eyes
  • Product Backlog - Establishing a sequential delivery order to maximise value delivered
  • Product Backlog Refinement - Understand iterative and incremental analysis
  • Definition of Ready (DoR) - Control the quality of requirements
  • User Stories and User Story Splitting - Utilise the most popular Agile requirement format
  • Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) - Understand how concrete examples can drive out assumptions and ambiguity
  • Job Stories - Understand your customers’ motivations and deliver a result that delights them
  • Fully-dressed and casual use-cases - Use-cases are a valid alternative to User Stories when applied correctly on an Agile project
  • Non-functional requirements - How to include non-functional requirements as part of the Product Backlog and/or Definition of Done (DoD)
  • Kanban - Track BA activities, and optimise the flow of requirements
  • Sprint operations - Deal with changing requirements, disruptive stakeholders, and teams that ask for unecessary detail


 


Private ABA Course

Please contact us to discuss options for in-house, private ABA courses. 

 


Who Should Attend

Business Analysts, Business Architects, Requirements Engineers, Systems Analysts, Process Analysts or anyone involved on an Agile team interested in learning how the role of Business Analyst fits within the Scrum framework will all benefit from this course.

 

 

Group Bookings and Invoices

We also offer discounts for group bookings and invoicing as a method of payment. For more information please contact us now.


  

Refund, Replacement and Postponement Policy

If you have booked onto a course and aren't able to make your course date please refer to our Refund, Replacement and Postponement Policy

events.name: Little Scientists STEM Computer Science Workshop, Erskineville NSW
events.summary:
Discover the concepts of computational thinking and learn how to “speak to a computer” by understanding how it works.


This STEM learning o
events.description_html:
Discover the concepts of computational thinking and learn how to “speak to a computer” by understanding how it works.


This STEM learning opportunity will help you:

  • playfully explore algorithms, sequencing and sorting

  • discover the basics of computational thinking

  • learn how to connect theory and practice in an engaging way

  • implement our inquiry-based educational approach

  • feel confident in unlocking the wonders of STEM

  • benefit from the exchange with other educators and teachers

  • take home information and inspiration in the Computer science booklet and cards you receive.

Feedback

'This is a fantastic workshop with lots of practical examples to take back and use in our program." Jenny Woo

Good to know: This workshop provides educators and teachers with a variety of tools and educational concepts to meet a range of requirements of the NQF and the EYLF.

Little Scientists workshops are endorsed to provide NESA Registered Professional Development for teachers accredited at Proficient Teacher level. Each workshop counts as five hours and 30 minutes of PD.

Date: Friday, 24 April 2020

Time: 9:30am - 4:30pm

Location: Gowrie Training Room, Level 1, 1 Elliott Avenue, Erskineville NSW 2043

Public transport: The closest train station is Erskineville Station and is a 5 mins walk from the venue.

Parking: Parking is available around surrounding streets of the venue.

Further information: wear clothing suitable for hands-on activities and experiments.

Cost: $200 per person. Ticket cost includes morning and afternoon tea. Please BYO lunch.

Who: this workshop is suitable for all teachers and educators and prior STEM knowledge is not required.

Facilitator: Lena Hammond, Little Scientists trainer

Bring a friend. We know from experience that people who come along with a friend or colleague tend to get more out of the workshop. If you know someone who’d benefit from this workshop, send them this link to find out more and join your workshop.

Please note: The workshop is for educators and teachers only and it is not suitable for children to attend.

Questions? Email us at workshops@littlescientists.org.au 

Terms and Conditions

Completing this workshop will contribute 5 hours and 30 minutes of NSW Education Standards Authority (NESA) Registered PD addressing Standard Descriptors 2.1.2, 3.3.2 and 6.2.2 from the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers towards maintaining Proficient Teacher Accreditation in NSW.

events.name: Introduction to the Artemis HPC
events.organiser: Sydney Informatics Hub, Core Research Facilities, DVCR, The University of Sydney
events.summary:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Zoom link to be provided.

Introduction to the Artemis High Performance Computer
events.description_html:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Zoom link to be provided.


Introduction to the Artemis High Performance Computer (HPC)

Please note: OWN LAPTOP REQUIRED with a terminal client installed.

Essential pre-requisites: Competency on the Unix/Linux command line. If you are interested in learning HPC but have no Unix/Linux command-line skills, you MUST first take an 'Introduction to Unix/Linux' course. These are scheduled regularly on campus.

Synopsis: Learn about the University of Sydney’s HPC ‘Artemis’, including directory structure, software, and how to submit and monitor compute jobs using the PBS Pro scheduling software. Also learn about the national HPC facilities and cloud services available.  Artemis is available at no cost to University of Sydney staff and students.

Target audience: Students and staff who would like to learn how to run compute jobs on Artemis HPC. Participants must have a valid USYD unikey.

Follow-on courses: This course is designed as a 2-part session, with 'Introduction to the Artemis HPC' in the morning and 'Data transfer and RDS for HPC' in the afternoon. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO REGISTER FOR BOTH.

Course notes and additional courses: https://sydney-informatics-hub.github.io/training.artemis/

For more information: Email sih.training@sydney.edu.au 

Sign up for email alerts about training: https://mailman.sydney.edu.au/mailman/listinfo/computing_training

Open wrench is a free night open to the general public to get a feel for working on bikes that provide. We guide you through the basics of a motorcycle and how it works. The workshop aims to show you things to do and make it easy for you to learn how to get your hands dirty in a fun environment with other like minded people. Numbers are limited and signing up is essential!

We provide everything you will need, all we ask is you come with an open mind and a will to learn. We promise you will take away some knowledge from these nights. If your thinking of buying a motorcycle, or have one but are not sure of the first place to start when it comes to the basics, then these nights are what you need!

events.name: Make a Ring in a Day Workshop - DIY Jewellery Class.
events.organiser: Masterful Makers - Luxury DIY Jewellery & Leather Workshops.
events.summary: You will learn how to design and fabricate a textured ring using various metals (copper, silver, or gold*) You will learn the basics of desi
events.description_html:
You will learn how to design and fabricate a textured ring using various metals (copper, silver, or gold*) You will learn the basics of designing, hammering, sawing, measuring, annealing, soldering, filing, and polishing the final piece.

The basic metalsmithing techniques of mark making will be explored using multiple hammers, letter stamps, number stamps and other tools. You will then have the opportunity to create your unique design.

*The gold can be 9k, 14k, or 18k. it can be used as an accent. This can be determined at the class setting.

events.name: Little Scientists STEM Acoustics Workshop, Erskineville NSW
events.summary:
Fizzle, crackle, crash, boom, bang; delve into the world of everyday sounds.


Explore the presence and absence of sound, create your own so
events.description_html:
Fizzle, crackle, crash, boom, bang; delve into the world of everyday sounds.


Explore the presence and absence of sound, create your own sound maker and tell a sound story. Emphasise the potential of peer group learning in co-constructed environments and reflect on the educator’s impact on group dynamics.

This STEM learning opportunity will help you:

  • recognise how co-constructed environments support peer group learning

  • reflect on the role of the educator in enhancing children’s verbal and non-verbal communication with peers

  • experience the effects of group dynamics on the learner

  • explore the world of sound by listening to the environment

  • discover acoustics by producing sounds, making noise and experiencing silence

  • benefit from the exchange with like-minded educators and reflect on your current practice

  • feel confident in unlocking the wonders of STEM

You will also receive comprehensive materials with lots of STEM ideas and information about inquiry-based practices.

Feedback

"Literally best PD ever!". Kirsty Myers

events.summary:
DID YOU LEARN SPANISH BEFORE? DO YOU WANT TO CHALLENGE YOURSELF?
If you have previously studied Spanish but you don't know what’s your level
events.description_html:
DID YOU LEARN SPANISH BEFORE? DO YOU WANT TO CHALLENGE YOURSELF?

If you have previously studied Spanish but you don't know what’s your level, you should be assessed by one of our teachers so that we can place you in a course appropriate to your skills. The cost of the level test is $38 (free until APRIL 23, 2020), which will later be deducted from your enrolment fee, effectively making it a free test upon enrolment. Level tests are valid for 4 months from the test date and include both written and oral aspects.

LEVEL TEST WILL BE CONDUCTED ONLINE - BOOK A 15 MIN APPOINTMENT FOR STARTING THE TEST

Below you will find the full process from start to end to complete the online level test:

https://sidney.cervantes.es/en/courses_spanish/level_tests.htm


If you have completed a DELE (Diplomas of Spanish as a Foreign Language) you will not require the level test.

Happy Endings Comedy Club is a prestigious, multi award winning venue bringing world-class stand up to the cool playground of Sydney's Kings Cross (in the non-seedy bit). Loved by comedians and audiences alike, this smoldering, intimate comedy club channels a vintage NYC jazz cellar vibe, with great drink prices, awesome food and a guaranteed good time.

Please arrive thirty minutes before show time and relax with a drink in our funky jazz bar - El Rocco. Our friendly staff will greet you at the door. Our bar (ground level) opens at 6.00pm and the show starts in our Theatre promptly at 8:30pm.

events.summary:
Have a wild time in the April school holidays 

Come and join us for our Primal Kids Adventure in the April school holidays. We’re going to
events.description_html:
Have a wild time in the April school holidays 

Come and join us for our Primal Kids Adventure in the April school holidays. We’re going to be doing a whole range of adventurous activities for 8-13 year olds, over 4 days and 3 nights. So blow off all those same old activity programs that you’ve been to a thousand times, get out of the neighbourhood and come and have some real fun. This is for all the kids who dream of adventures to far away places! Check out the website for further details https://www.primaladventures.com.au/adventure/primal-kids-april-2020/

events.name: WEBINAR 1: Farm Biodiversity Certification Scheme Trial
events.summary:
JOIN ZOOM MEETING
In 2019 the Australian Government announced funding for the implementation of an Australian Farm Biodiversity Scheme to be
events.description_html:
JOIN ZOOM MEETING

In 2019 the Australian Government announced funding for the implementation of an Australian Farm Biodiversity Scheme to be developed and led by the National Farmers' Federation (NFF). As part of the Agriculture Stewardship Package, the aim of the scheme is to reward farmers for managing biodiversity on farm through market-based mechanisms and thus enable the continued provision of natural capital benefits to the wider community.

The Australian Farm Institute (AFI) has been appointed to conduct Phase 1 of the Scheme, focused on desktop and consultative research, reviewing international best practice management standards for relevant agricultural biodiversity programs. The project for this phase will assess commonalities in existing methods and determine their potential applicability in Australian agricultural systems, and these findings will then underpin the practical development and trial of biodiversity market mechanisms to be developed in phases 2 and 3.

An integral part of Phase 1 is a series of consultative forums held in regional areas across the country between March and May to identify critical success factors that will be required for implementation of biodiversity schemes in Australia. After the initial desk review of international and domestic options, the resulting catalogue of schemes will be presented to stakeholders for feedback via open group forums (as welll as stakeholder meetings and key informant interviews) to assist in determining desirable and non-desirable elements of relevant schemes in relation to their applicability to Australian agriculture. 

Forums are free to attend, however RSVP is required. If you are unable to attend a forum in person, please register for a webinar.

  • SEE THE LIST OF OTHER FORUMS / WEBINARS

events.name: Edge Business Networking Breakfast
events.summary: By attending our business networking breakfasts you will have an opportunity to meet and network with group members who have a very high cal
events.description_html:
By attending our business networking breakfasts you will have an opportunity to meet and network with group members who have a very high calibre of contacts and potential referral partners for you.

 A sample of some of the people you will meet includes:-

  • A branding director whose current / past clients include NSW Health, Westpac, NSW Treasury and more;
  • A business advisor who is a Start Up Australia ambassador and has a very high level of success in building, growing and selling businesses - both his own and other people's.
  • An IT specialist who performed global IT support for Virgin management senior execs on Richard Branson’s boat as well as assisting with IT for Kylie Kwong and Luke Mangan.
  • A bookkeeping agency Director whose current and past clients include Rachel Ruddick, One Teaspoon, FBI Fashion College, MaxMara, Matt Church and Fast Ed
  • An executive coach with contacts at BMW, Fox Sports, Ernst & Young and UTS
  • A natural health and fertility expert whose clients include ‘hatted’ chefs and well known actors

 and many others with amazing networks and contacts that they can introduce you to.

 

Please book in quickly as we only have a limited number of visitor spots available and they will go fast.

BNI - Business Network International is a business and professional networking organization whose primary purpose is to exchange qualified business referrals. It is the largest networking organisation of its kind. Currently, BNI has over 6400 chapters internationally. Last year, members of BNI passed 7 million referrals, which generated $3.2 Billion worth of business for each other.

 What makes BNI unique is that it allows only one person per classification to join a chapter.  Thus, once you have joined, none of your competitors can participate.

Remember to bring plenty of business cards to pass around, as you will meet lots of local business professionals.

events.summary: Heard about essential oils? Maybe you already use them? Maybe you have always wanted to find out more? What if I said there was a way to liv
events.description_html:
Heard about essential oils? Maybe you already use them? Maybe you have always wanted to find out more? What if I said there was a way to live a more natural and healthier life? Would you want to find out more?

Essential oils can enhance so many areas of your daily life. They're often used for immune support, relaxation and sleep, stress relief, emotional balance, skin care, respiratory health, cleaning, and even muscle tension and pain.

Here's your opportiunity to find out more. We are going to give you all the tools to help get started with essential oils.

You will learn about essential oil safety, how essential oils are produced, and common methods of use. You'll also learn how to create a more natural, healthy lifestyle through the use of essential oils.

Some of the topics we will be covering on the day include:

  • What essential oils are?

  • How they work

  • How they are produced

  • Managing stress with essential oils

  • Natural remedies for everyday ailments and sniffles

  • Dealing with sleep problems the natural way

You will have opportunities to experience essential oils first hand and understand the best way to source oils for you and your family.

If you have any questions, please contact us at hello@welloiledmachine.co.uk.

We look forward to meeting you.

events.name: UNSW Founders Information Session
events.summary: Thanks for your interest in UNSW Founders, Australia’s most comprehensive university entrepreneurship program. Our coaching services and pre
events.description_html:
Thanks for your interest in UNSW Founders, Australia’s most comprehensive university entrepreneurship program. Our coaching services and pre-accelerator and accelerator programs are free and accessible to UNSW students, academic staff and Alumni – for life!

These information sessions run online from 12-1pm. You will be emailed the zoom meeting link 24 hours prior to the session (please check your junk folder if you have not received).

Please download the zoom software prior to the meeting time: https://unsw.zoom.us/

This is a great opportunity for you to connect with our startup coaches, fellow entrepreneurs and kick off your journey with UNSW Founders. 

Agenda:

1. Completing the UNSW Founders intake form

2. Who’s in the virtual room

3. UNSW Founders programs and services

4. Matching you with a coach

5. Q&A

Unfortunately, some elements of the UNSW Founders programs and services are not available to professional staff, unless you are also UNSW alumni.

Terms and Conditions apply.

PRIVACY STATEMENT

UNSW is collecting your personal information in this form for the purpose of providing you with more information about the UNSW Founders Program. UNSW is using a third party (Microsoft) to provide the technology platform for this registration form on behalf of UNSW. As a result, any personal information you provide in this form will be processed by Microsoft. Information collected by the University through this form may be processed outside of New South Wales and Australia. The supply of personal information is voluntary. You can request access to and amendment of information we hold about you by contacting founders@unsw.edu.au. The privacy and confidentiality of the personal information held about you will be respected. Personal information collected by UNSW is managed in accordance with its Privacy Management Plan.

By registering for this event/workshop you grant UNSW Founders full rights to use the images from any photography/video footage for publicity and education purposes. This may include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, coursework presentations, social media and press releases. If you do not wish to be photographed please inform an event organiser.

events.name: Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC
events.organiser: Sydney Informatics Hub, Core Research Facilities, DVCR, The University of Sydney
events.summary:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series
Zoom link will be provided.

Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC
events.description_html:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series

Zoom link will be provided.


Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC

Please note: OWN LAPTOP REQUIRED with a terminal client installed.

Essential pre-requisites: Competency on the Unix/Linux command line. If you are interested in learning HPC but have no Unix/Linux command-line skills, you MUST first take an 'Introduction to Unix/Linux' course. These are scheduled regularly on campus.

Synopsis: Learn to navigate and interact with the University of Sydney's Research Data Storage options. Learn how to transfer data between your local computer, an external source, the Research Data Store (RDS) and the Artemis High Performance Computer (HPC). Learn how to back up HPC output onto the RDS. 

Target audience: Students and staff who would like to learn how to run compute jobs on Artemis HPC. Participants must have a valid USYD unikey.

Follow-on courses: This course is designed as a 2-part session, with 'Introduction to the Artemis HPC' in the morning and 'Data transfer and RDS for HPC' in the afternoon. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO REGISTER FOR BOTH.

Course notes and additional courses: https://sydney-informatics-hub.github.io/training.artemis/

For more information: Email sih.training@sydney.edu.au 

Sign up for email alerts about training: https://mailman.sydney.edu.au/mailman/listinfo/computing_training

Flood The Streets with VIRTUAL Earth-Day-Art Show Wed 4/22/2

2020 Marks Earth Day’s 50th Anniversary!
Wed April 22, 2020
EARTH DAY LIVE ANYWHERE YOU ARE
ON APRIL 22, EARTH DAY GOES DIGITAL
JOIN US FOR 24 Hrs of Earthly ART ACTION,
Add an art piece, browse the virtual art show & let's show Mother Earth the amazing people and artist she has CREATED.

Creative to the Core Joins earthday.org/earth-day-live/

Sacramento:
West Coast: https://www.facebook.com/events/2377258839268006
This will all get collected & added to a special website page & Celebrated ALL YEAR!!!

2020 marks Earth Day’s 50th Anniversary! YES Since 1970.
As the global coordinator of Earth Day, Network is working to make sure that Earth Day 2020 is the most diverse global mobilization in defense of the environment in world history.

They work year-round with more than 50,000 partner organizations in 190 countries, and our global campaigns and programs bring hundreds of thousands of new voices—representing all walks of life.

The opportunity is before us now to use the 50th anniversary of Earth Day as a catalytic event to reignite the environmental movement and unite the vast array of groups and individuals who care for and protect the earth.

Want to get involved? Sign up for updates check their site and social media for regular updates.
Get Involved: The first Earth Day in 1970 enlisted 20 million Americans and is credited with launching the modern environmental movement. It is now recognized as the planet’s largest civic event and it led to the passage of landmark environmental laws in the United States, including the Clean Air, Clear Water and Endangered Species Acts. Many countries soon adopted similar laws, and the United Nations chose Earth Day 2016 to sign the Paris climate agreement.
https://www.earthday.org/earthday/countdown-to-2020/

Questions, concerns, comments or remarks can be messaged here.

events.name: Staying Connected
events.organiser: Rockland Singles 50 Plus Afternoon Walks, Hikes, Arts & Ent.
events.description_html:
I am following in our friend and wonderful organizer Martines' footsteps in setting up this "on line, daily meetup". It will be for the duration of this pandemic or until it no longer seems needed.

The purpose of this "daily meetup" is to keep everyone connected and to share what you are doing to get thru this challenging time.

Feel free to share photos of scenic places you have been to or are going to during this time, poetry, inspirational secular quotes, tasteful links to jokes and utubes to uplift our spirits, recipes, exercise utubes, etc.

Other activities we can continue to do are gardening, feeding the birds, enjoying our wildlife, star gazing, reading, online classes, dancing, drumming, chanting, singing, arts and crafts, bicycling, walks and hikes on your own and everything keeping a 6 foot social distance. Ideally the least amount of people you come into contact with the better for everyone. This is a good time to de-clutter if you have the inspiration, catch up with old friends and family by phone, letters, emails, FaceTime, etc.

There are also volunteer opportunities but first and mostly take care of yourself and your health by washing your hands often, avoiding touching your face, using disinfectant wipes and hand sanitizers with 60% or more of alcohol, using masks and disposable gloves where there are large crowds like supermarkets. Avoid carpooling, food sharing and gathering in confined places. As many of us are in the over 60 "kid" crowd, we need to be especially careful as we have become "delicate flowers" !

There will always be some conflicting info out there so it is always best to err on the side of caution until this passes. To a brighter tomorrow and may we share many more good times in the months and years to come! May the Force be With Us! With much love and healing wishes.

events.name: GET VIRTUAL, How to Go Live Like a Pro
events.description_html:
WHY THIS WEBINAR?
You already see that you have no choice but to take your interactions online right now. But not everyone will take the time to learn the tech tips and tricks to create a valuable viewer experience that matches their brand.

It's clear to me that my community could use some help to get their events virtual. If I could just reach everyone at once to tell them how to translate their activities with the right equipment, then we all win.

WHO IS TEACHING?
My company, House of 8 Media, averages 40 productions a year (until now.) It's no wonder that I've been called the "The Lens of the New Peninsula." There are many things I'm not great at...but one of my biggest gifts is that I'm a super-hero in the realm of TEACHING video production. I'm able to take complicated processes and break it down in a way that is easy for anyone to understand.

For example, under my initial supervision, right now a minimal staff at the Carmel Academy of Performing Arts is able to produce multiple dance classes per day with dozens of students tuning it to take class at home. They understood the need to revaluate their service-delivery model and Get Virtual.

WHAT IS THIS WEBINAR ABOUT?
In this webinar, I will personally coach you getting started with professional-quality virtual live events (i.e. teaching/performing/fundraising/presenting online.)

This 1-hr webinar will help you transition from live events to virtual events by filling this hour with content - not explanation. We'll cover how to achieve high creative standards, which platforms to choose, my principles of virtual meeting etiquette, and you'll leave with a bundle of .pdfs including an Expert Buyer's Guid with recommendations on which equipment to buy now:

LET'S GET STARTED
Virtual IS Real. In my opinion, it doesn’t really matter if you make the time in person or at home. The biggest difference is that if there is a barrier of any kind - whether quality or how it's presented – it will keep your audience from being fully present - if at all.

WHO IS THIS FOR?
Every business owner, institution, organization, entrepreneur, or live performance is a candidate to seize the opportunity of going virtual. I know this because I’m seeing it every day. I’m on a mission to develop an army of first time video producers. I’m actively seeking creative types to teach them everything I know, connect them with each other, and actually provide them with SOLUTIONS.

See you on the call,
Mike Buffo, The eDirector
Director of Photography/Production at House of 8 Media

En ces temps inédits de confinement, je propose des ateliers créatifs (gratuits) en ligne 2 fois par semaine, le dimanche et le mercredi à 14h, d'une durée de 30-40 minutes.

La veille de chaque atelier les liens de connexion, le thème et le matériel sont en ligne sur la page Facebook MARCHER SUR LA QUEUE DU TIGRE et sur mon blog.

Nous faisons avec le matériel de bord. Réunissez quelques vieux magazines, du papier blanc, un tube de colle, une paire de ciseaux, les crayons de couleurs et les feutres que vous avez, un crayon à papier, une gomme et vos stylos et gardez quelques cartons d'emballage.

Ces ateliers s'adressent plutôt aux adultes mais les adolescents et les enfants à partir de 10 ans (aux côtés de leur(s) parent(s)) peuvent participer. Chacun fait à sa mesure.

Rejoignez-nous !
Séverine Bourguignon

events.name: BNI Del Mar - Networking, Introductions, and Business Referrals
events.organiser: BNI Del Mar - San Diego North County Business Networking
events.description_html:
Leaders in the local business community meet regularly to maintain a pulse on local business, build professional relationships, and increase the impact of their own endeavors via personal introductions and warm referrals.

Our mission is to help local professionals increase their influence and impact through a structured, positive and professional environment which enables development of long-term, meaningful relationships with quality business professionals.

Each week regular participants and visitors all have a brief opportunity to stand and share trends in their businesses and where they add value for others. The agenda also intentionally includes time to help others with networking connections and business referrals. In this environment, givers gain!

Maintaining ongoing professional relationships benefits businesses through all market cycles, as people continue to do business with - and refer people - that they know, like and trust.

Grateful for our alliance with BNI, we are an exclusive category organization that allows only one person per professional classification to participate regularly. VISITORS ARE WELCOMED! We value the opportunity to connect with new visitors at all events posted on our Meetup calendar. If you are a leader in your field, we'd love to meet you.

Meetings are nearly every week throughout the year (with some holiday exceptions). The meeting fee of $20 (cash or check only) includes buffet breakfast and beverages. There is plenty of free parking in the LSFCC public parking lot.

Visitors should come prepared with a thick stack of business cards. These will be passed around the room for you. First-time visitors are encouraged to check-in no later than 6:30am. There is a short visitor orientation at 8:25am where more information is available - and questions answered - regarding BNI.

Our weekly event is one of the very best ways to connect and gain visibility within the local business community. We look forward to meeting you soon and learning more about your endeavors.

More information on the group is also at:
https://bnisd.com/ca-san-diego-county-west-bni-del-mar/en-US/index

BNI is the world's leading referral organization. More information is at:
https://www.bni.com
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BNI_(organization)

For any further information, please contact our Growth Coordinator:

Angie Gange
[masked]
[masked]

events.description_html:
This is where the rubber meets the road! We meet every other Wednesday. Everyone will get a chance to speak and give a 1-3min commercial about who they are, what they do, and who they are looking to be introduced to!

Please bring business cards and a positive attitude! We meet early to avoid interrupting business hours and to find those dedicated to what they do.

Everyone is welcome however we do only allow 1 member per industry. If your industry is taken and you still come for a visit, your name will be put on a list and you will be notified when the spot becomes available!

This is a great group to be a part of, we started mid-2018 and have already generated thousands in closed business for our members. Just as importantly, we are establishing meaningful relationships, helping those learn about managing and growing a business and have made new friends along the way!

We look forward to meeting you and seeing where we can help!

events.name: Burro Wash Road in Boulder City
events.description_html:
Burro Wash is a 4x4 trail that ends in a cove on the Colorado River. This is an Out & Back trail

Rated 3-4(Moderate).
Stock Wrangler or equivalent will be fine, with 4x4. Heavy duty all terrain tires with working spare. CB recommended but not required.
Desert pin-striping possible.

This scenic route follows a dirt and rock trail that initially runs along the power lines before passing through Black Canyon and traveling down a wash. This trail will have some minor washed out areas, slightly off camber spots, and minor fun rocky obstacles.

Bring your food and water, we will stop for lunch on the Colorado River

events.description_html:

Due to the social distancing, currently, we may end up calling ahead to order and support those restaurants/pubs that will still do takeout and sit on our bikes, a safe distance apart, to eat before heading home. We will play that by ear given the daily change in circumstances.

We have a great mix of riders - Men and Women and variety of bikes - Cruisers, sport bikes, adventure, etc... We go all over the place and our leaders usually decide on the moment where that is, and we have lots of fun!

This is a casual ride. If it’s raining you may be on your own as many of us will not ride in inclement weather. We do not manage and notify canceled rides.

events.name: Chuck's Wednesday Ride to Nowhere
events.description_html:
This will be a weekly ride about 40 to 70 miles and about 60 - 90 minutes long. Each week will take us on a different route through Volusia, Lake, Marion and/or Flagler counties. Chuck has a few routes already planned, but he is open to any new route suggestions.

Let's end Hump Day with a relaxing ride to nowhere. We will always meet at the BP gas station at 2185 W New York Ave W, FL-44, DeLand, FL 32720 (on West 44 at the roundabout). Meetup time is 5:45pm with KSU (kick stands up) at 6:00pm. Make sure you fill your tanks before the ride as we do not make any stops. Guests are always welcome, so please feel free to bring a passenger and/or other riders. This is a rain or shine event, so bring your rain gear just in case. We will cancel the ride if the weather is determined to be too dangerous for riding.

For more information or questions, contact Chuck at [masked]. If you are going to attend a ride, but are running late, text Chuck at [masked]. We leave promptly at 6pm unless I know you are on your way.

Please take time to fill out our "After Action Survey" after the ride. Your feedback will help us understand where we excel and where we may be falling behind. Your submission is anonymous (unless you include an email address for a response), so please don't hold back on the good and/or bad. Our goal is to make this a fun ride for everyone! You can find the survey at this link: https://www.theallriders.com/aas

events.name: Lessons Learned from IT Cyber–Security Applied to Automotive
events.organiser: Automotive Security Research Group Tel Aviv (ASRG-TLV)
events.description_html:
Dear ASRG-TLV fellows,

Join us for our second ASRG-WORLD LiveStream, the online (COVID Approved) version of ASRG. Next edition of our webinar series will include Gilad Bandel, VP Products at Arilou Cyber Security and he will be talking about the lessons learned that we need to understand and carry over into the automotive industry.

PRESENTATION:

"Lessons Learned from IT & ICS/SCADA Cyber–Security Applied to Automotive"

The thesis presented here is that we can look back at three (not so) very different computing and network environments, study and analyze their histories and conclude what is expected to come in a new field. Specifically, we shall review the analogies between the IT (Information Technologies) networks, OT (Operational Technologies) – ICS (Industrial Control System)/SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) and the automotive cyber–security protection solutions trying to anticipate the future of the automotive cyber–security market based on similarities from the IT and ICS/SCADA behavior.

The claim is that history will repeat itself and we can safely investigate the distant past of the IT world, the more recent ICS/SCADA fields, review the status of the automotive cyber-security and predict the future of things to come in this discipline. Furthermore, the trends foreseen here will be probably valid for additional emerging fields such as other transportation fields (railways, maritime and aviation), IoT (Internet of Things), IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things), Smart cities, Intelligent Transportation Systems, etc.

Thanks,
The ASRG-TLV Admin Team

ABOUT THE PRESENTER:

Gilad Bandel

Vice President of Products at Arilou Cyber Security

Gilad drives Arilou’s automotive cyber-security product development. His focus is on delivering unique, innovative and novel functionality - delivering to market state-of-the-art solutions for in-vehicle cyber-security protection.

Gilad is an accomplished executive with over 30 years of experience in the cyber-security and networking industries. Having covered markets in Europe, America and the APAC region, Gilad is a renowned expert in conceptualizing and developing go-to-market strategies. He specializes in business development for cyber-security devices and IoT solutions, in critical infrastructure and homeland security markets.

Prior to joining Arilou, Gilad served as VP of Product at Radiflow and as Director of Product Management at CyberSeal (a Magal Security company). His goal was to provide cyber-security solutions for critical infrastructure. Earlier positions held include VP of R&D, and CTO at leading networking, telecommunication and homeland security companies.

During the competition, you can join the ASRG Slack channel for support and discussions. The Secure Code Warrior team will also be present to support questions and conversation.

Your ASRG-TLV Admin Team

events.name: Earth Day Live
events.description_html:
Strike, divest, and vote for our future.
From April 22, the 50th anniversary of Earth Day, to April 24, activists, performers, thought leaders, and artists will come together for an empowering, inspiring, and communal three day livestream mobilization.

Register: https://strikewithus.org/

April 22 STRIKE - Earth Day and Youth Climate Strikes
On the 50th anniversary of Earth Day, we will demonstrate our collective power and unity through community building and storytelling. This first day will focus on amplifying the voice of indigenous leaders and youth climate activists who are leading the movement to halt the climate crisis.

events.name: Earth Day Live
events.description_html:
Earth Day Live is three days of action packed content that will inspire, empower, educate. Grounding the three days in the need for community, hope, and togetherness during such a difficult time, the three days will still follow a similar theme as the original Earth Day Strikes.

More information: https://www.earthdaylive2020.org

One local event is Political Engagement Through Citizens Climate Lobby, on April 24, 2020 at 12:00 PM via Zoom. RSVP: https://actionnetwork.org/events/political-engagement-through-citizens-climate-lobby

On Wednesday, April 22, the kick off of Earth Day Live, we will demonstrate our collective power and unity through community building and storytelling. Originally a day of mass mobilization, we are leaning into healing and togetherness to provide comfort and inspiration during this time of unknown. As with all three days, we are using this platform to lift up the stories and voices of frontline, Indigenous, and POC leaders.

On the second day, Thursday, April 23, we will target financial institutions across the country, calling for a global reset. We want to reprogram the economy so that it works for people and planet, not polluters and politicians. As we work to rebuild from the damage COVID-19 has done, we will be offering actions and explanations in how this can be done in a sustainable and equitable way.

On the third day, Friday, April 24, we will focus on the urgency of political change through a nationwide youth voter registration day. We’ll be using this day as an opportunity to train youth organizers on using digital, relational voter registration tools, and calling on elected officials to support the youth climate strike demands.

events.name: Earth Day Virtual Celebration
events.description_html: April 22nd is the 50th anniversary of Earth Day. To celebrate, choose an activity to do with whoever you might be sheltering in place with. This could be making outdoor environmental art, creating a sign, nature play or nature art with young kids, shutting off the lights for an hour, etc. Make sure to document your activity so we can share our collective efforts online. Once you RSVP, we'll send a link to a shared folder so you can add photos or video of your celebration.

events.name: Address change: Cook a meal for the homeless
events.description_html:
We have moved location to cook at a larger kitchen in north side in Andersonville. Also you have the option to start an hour earlier at 9 am instead of 10 am. Safety protocols will be in place to keep all volunteers safe while we practice social distancing while we cook.

Join Fight2Feed as we help cook and feed 200+ meals for the homeless and families in need. This is a Wednesday day time project with the Chicago Help Initiative and Catholic Charities. It usually occurs on the third Wednesday of the month, with a few exceptions. Volunteers will meet at the NEW location at Hutch Restaurant, 1477 W. Winnemac Ave, Chicago IL 60640.

Chicago Help Initiative Wednesday for 2020 are:

1/15, 2/19, 4/1, 4/22, 5/20, 6/17, 7/15, 8/19, 9/16, 10/14, 11/18, 12/16

Volunteer shifts are from 9 AM to 4 PM in 3 hour blocks. If you have to leave early or come later than the listed shift time, that is OK too.
10 AM to 1 PM - bring food in from loading dock, prep and cook
1 PM to 4:30 PM - cook and pack food for transport

Let front desk know you are here to cook in the kitchen. It is in the back of the dinning room on your right.

Please dress appropriately to work in a kitchen. Wear closed toe shoes with non slip bottoms, like sneakers. Slacks, jeans. or long pants. No shorts or tank tops allowed. You will be asked to wear a hair net or you can bring a baseball cap to manage your hair. You can also bring your own apron if you own one.

About our organizations:
A 501(C)(3) organization, Fight2Feed’s mission is to make a difference by changing the rise of food insecure communities by fighting hunger one block at a time. The non-profit has over 650 volunteers with presence in Chicago, Kansas City, San Diego, Atlanta and Indianapolis. For more information, to donate or volunteer, visit fight2feed.org (http://fight2feed.org/), like on Facebook (http://facebook.com/fight2feed) or follow on Twitter (http://twitter.com/fight2feed).

Fight2Feed combines donated restaurant resources with the mobility of food trucks and volunteer driven cars to delivery food to where food is needed the most in our city. Our organization is 100% volunteer run and supported. We have served over 55,000 meals to people in need in the last 3 years, and have rescued thousands of pounds of surplus food in 2017 from restaurants and other events to be redistributed to hungry citizens in need.

The Chicago Help Initiative (CHI) is a consortium of business, residential, religious, social service, institutional and volunteer leaders striving to promote an atmosphere of dignity and compassion toward those in need by providing access to food, health services, shelter and employment. CHI works to educate local businesses and residents as to how they can help ease the plight of the homeless, disadvantaged and out of work individuals and improve their well-being, self esteem and productivity.

events.name: Earth Day/Week 2020 Considerations - Open discussion
events.description_html:
It's Earth Day tomorrow, so I'd like to invite you to a 30-minute Zoom meeting to introduce ourselves and discuss the day. If attendee requests warrant we can do another session.

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83696777739?pwd=REMxYTg4MFJxODhzSWlHcUtmVXZKZz09

Meeting ID:[masked]
Password: 6KhpaZ

Below is a message I sent out a couple of weeks ago that you may not have received:
Nature Guelph is going through a unique transformation—as aspects of our world change in ways that a short time ago were unimaginable.

I’m composing this message while hiking in the Gorba Forest. Just received an alert on my phone that we are all to stay home.

This is such a difficult time for all of us with so much uncertainty.

In an unprecedented way, parks and conservation areas are being closed off to the public. This is alarming and deeply concerns me, right now.

My lifelong appreciation of our country’s natural areas, and the many amazing and restorative experiences I’ve enjoyed, inspire me to explore the beneficial opportunities that could arise and aid us in overcoming this catastrophe.

I believe we need to consider how we can transform our natural areas, not close them, to help us through this pandemic and even guide us to a more environmentally responsible and sustainable future.

I’m thinking to host the first Zoom meeting this coming week, so we can start exploring different ideas that could help stimulate inspired change.

I’d also appreciate your feedback and insights in the form of comments and messages.

Please feel free to share this message, and an invitation to join Nature Guelph, with your family and friends.

Regards... Toma

PS: You could also visit TomaCreative.ca to learn a bit more about what I do.

events.name: COVID-19 Main Street Bucket Brigade: Saving Small Businesses & Nonprofits
events.summary: Weekly webinar and Q&A with Dr. Gripne on financial innovation & impact investing in various sectors.
events.description_html:
Weekly webinar and Q&A with Dr. Gripne on financial innovation & impact investing in various sectors. Please see below for upcoming topics.

About this Event
*While general tickets for this are $10, we never want cost to be a barrier, therefore there is a free ticket option available upon checkout for anyone who needs it!

Wednesday 4/22/20: How the Main Street Bucket Brigade Can Help Save the Small Businesses & Nonprofits You Care About

Summary: Join us to learn more about how IFC's new "611 Solution" can catalyze millions of dollars to help save Main Street small businesses and nonprofits. This Enterprise Integrated Full Spectrum Investment concept will both help us through the economic crisis looming because of the pandemic, but will also help us build a more just, resilient, and equitable economy post-pandemic.

Description

Keeping small businesses and nonprofits alive during the pandemic may be the difference between a global recession versus depression. Because the CARES Act is too slow and does not adequately provide a safety net to keep many U.S. small businesses and nonprofits open during the pandemic, Impact Finance Center has been prototyping the Main Street Bucket Brigade and Enterprise Full Spectrum Capital Investment.

Main Street Bucket Brigade is self-help infrastructure. We are dedicated to keeping Main Street social ventures - projects, nonprofits, small businesses, startups, cooperatives, and funds alive during the pandemic. If you are a Main Street social venture, you are invited to pre-sell your goods or services, request donations, or request Main Street loans.

We are also inviting community members who want to spearhead a Bucket Brigade in their geography and/or interest area to join us and learn more about how they can help their local businesses get on this platform.

If you would like to see previous webinar series recordings click here: https://impactfinctr.co/pathwrightwebinars

For any questions or comments email us at [masked]

The presentation will begin with the basics of ventilation systems, but also discuss new technologies and types of systems that are appearing on the market. This webinar will be of particular interest to those Passive House practitioners who deal with building services, but will also provide valuable information for everyone involved in the Passive House design process.

(USE THIS LINK: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/virtual-grant-providers-panel-meetup-tickets-101918894156)

Our Grant Provider Panel Meetup will now be held virtually.

These grant providers represent a range of grants from monthly $1000 micro-grants to one-time grants of $111,500. I am honored to announce our first ever panel of grant providers:

• Michelle Rankin, Impact Incubator for Impact Austin
• Michele Walker-Moak, Global Community Affairs Manager for Applied Materials
• Megan Stillman, Co-dean of Austin Chapter of the Awesome Foundation

A fourth panelist may be added in which case I will update this announcement.

This is your opportunity to learn to be the best you can be in seeking grants from a diversity of types of funders, even during these uncertain times. They will share information on the topics below, as well as leave enough time for your questions.

Topics covered by our panelists:
• Description of foundation or company
• Funding priorities
• How COVID–19 has impacted grant application process and funding
• Type of application (online or otherwise)
• Whether they accept phone calls from potential applicants who have questions
• Deadlines for applications
• What stands out for them in an application both positively and negatively
• Any advice they might have for grant seekers in general

All attendees will be muted, and your video blocked, for this meeting to minimize background noise and to ensure less video streaming issues. Please know there will be ample time after their presentation on each topic to take your questions. All questions will be via the chat bar (“Chat” icon at the bottom of the screen.) At the start of our Meetup/Zoom meeting, I will remind you to please write down your questions as you are listening to the panelists, rather than add them to the chat box at that moment. Then, when the panelists tell me they are ready for questions, I will invite you to add your questions to the chat box (somewhat slowly, please!) as I will be moderating your questions and delivering them to the panelists. While we hope to get to every question, please understand that if your question is highly specific to your nonprofit, we might not be able to address it during this forum.

There is a $11.71 fee payable to register which includes service and processing fees. For those of you who paid previously for this Meetup, I will send you the link directly

events.name: *Registration required! 2020 Fifty Years of Earth Day Celebrations
events.organiser: Cottonwood - Northern AZ Climate Change Alliance
events.description_html:
The Earth Day network has chosen Climate Change as the overarching theme for this year’s Earth Day observance. Northern Arizona Climate Change Alliance (NAZCCA) is hosting a webinar panel celebration of the 50th anniversary of Earth Day “. NAZCCA welcomes Cottonwood Mayor Tim Eliniski, legislative district 6 representative Walt Blackman, candidates running for office: Coral Evans (State House), Felicia French (State Senate) and county supervisor candidate Donna Michaels. It is essential for all of us to hear from our lawmakers and candidates on this threat to human existence. It is an historic moment when the citizens of the world rise up in a united call for the creativity, innovation, ambition, and bravery that we need to meet our climate crisis and seize the enormous opportunities of a zero-carbon future.
Registration is required to attend this webinar and space is limited. Please register as soon as possible to secure your spot!
Click location to register for the webinar.
You will receive a confirmation. This link is only to register. You will be emailed a link to the actual webinar on the day of the digital event.
This digital event is sponsored by NAZCCA and Yavapai College OLLI Verde Campus
*This webinar will be recorded and posted to the NAZCCA.org website for sharing and viewing in case you cannot attend the webinar.

events.name: Learning for Planetary Health: Early Lessons from a Pandemic (Part 2 of 3)
events.description_html:
As we face one of the greatest challenges for public health in several generations with the COVID-19 pandemic, we also have an unprecedented opportunity as governments and citizens prepare for a post-COVID future that we hope will not be simply restoring everything to the way it was. The pandemic has been described as climate change at warp speed. But the response to this "greatest challenge" has been quite different. Since this is such a ripe opportunity for learning, we (several eco-health colleagues and the SFU Planetary Health research group) are organizing a couple webinars with perhaps more if there's demand. We will begin by exploring the origins of the outbreak with lessons from the animal-human interface. We will then learn from previous economic collapses and what these lessons teach us about the coming weeks and months as we emerge from the current wave of disease and economic devastation to become a healthier planet than we were before the current pandemic. We will explore the relationships and resources needed for a recovery that makes us stronger and better able to face the challenges to planetary health that are even more critical than the COVID-19 pandemic, but that appear less imminent to society. Our primary goal is to articulate a shared vision of this future where society bounces back but bounces back to a better place than our pre-pandemic world.

Session 2 Apr. 22 (MeetHere.org) 12:30-2pm Pacific Daylight Time (PDT)
- Kris Ebi, PhD. International dimensions of the crisis, what the pandemic could mean for climate change adaptation
- Maya Gislason, PhD. Recovery for everyone: equity issues and lessons from the pandemic
- Chris Buse, PhD. Climate Change in a time of COVID: Bouncing forward, not back

UPDATED web link for this event: https://www.meethere.org/conferences/learning-for-planetary-health

events.name: Earth Day: Rally Online for a Green New Deal
events.description_html:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSejntBVXtmdRIeycYJZaZbquvDmWJgj8mfCIjkXKWbo6ftISQ/viewform

https://www.facebook.com/events/578667519411916/

Although COVID-19 will prevent us from meeting in person, we know that now more than ever, we need to stick together and keep fighting for the health and well-being of all people. The health and economic impacts caused by both the COVID crisis and the climate crisis demand bold solutions that center the needs of working people and marginalized communities.

Our movement seeks those solutions using our People Power, and we’re ready to wield that power even though we can’t take to the streets...the show must go on(line)! Please join us to Rally Online for a Green New Deal on Wednesday April 22nd, from 4:00 - 5:30pm. We’ll hear from inspiring speakers about the connections between COVID-19 and climate, what a Green New Deal could look like in our community, and why we need it. We'll also hear personal stories and take crucial political actions together from our homes.

We’re asking you to bring 3 friends with you to the rally. (That means you should probably ask 6 people!) Or more!
Share the RSVP link below, or invite them to our event on Facebook. Please share the attached flyer. Send it to friends, print it out and put it up in your windows, or ask your grocery store if you can post it publicly. Although we have to keep our physical distance, this moment demands social solidarity. We must stick together.
See you on Earth Day.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSejntBVXtmdRIeycYJZaZbquvDmWJgj8mfCIjkXKWbo6ftISQ/viewform

events.description_html:
Free Application below
http://eepurl.com/gkcDdT

Embrace your sensuality through dancing in heels. This is your time to feel like a queen! Learn to walk, strut, shake & shimmy in our Stilettos class. The dance class starts with a warm-up, consisting of body movements, designed to help you become aware of your body and learn how to move it beautifully. Then, a short choreography is taught with simple moves and a whole lot of sass & attitude, easy for you to follow. Rest assured that it will boost your confidence, raise body-positivity and let you feel awesome as a woman. We offer you a safe and fun environment to express yourself freely, reconnect with your body and feel sexy in your own skin.

For 50 min - we are royalty.

Price : 10 Euro (we have a cheaper options with 10 lessons, 5 lessons ticket as well)
https://ism.virtuagym.com/webshop/onlinelessons

USC / ClassPass is available as well

This is an open-level class. All you need is some floor-space at home, a water bottle and some comfortable stretchy clothes you feel sexy in! Heels are recommended, but not a must. Salsa shoes are a good option. Socks or barefeet would also do.

What Kind of Heels Should I Wear to a Heels Class?
* Safety First *
When choosing your hills, remember:
1. The higher the heel, the harder it is to dance.
2. An ideal shoe for a heels class has a stiletto heel. If you’re new, try wearing a shoe with a thicker heel.
3. Ankle support is everything! Your ankle and foot must be secure in your shoe. Pick a shoe that comes all the way up to your ankle and that is tight around it.

Follow the link for more heels info: https://medium.com/@laurabduma/what-kind-of-heels-should-i-wear-to-a-heels-class-478e589377a3

events.name: On-Line Meeting - Conquer your fear of public speaking & build leadership skills
events.description_html:
"Virtual Toastmasters Meeting - Conquer your fear of public speaking & build leadership skills

Stuck at home during the Bay Area Covid-19 lockdown? Beat the social isolation while building public speaking, technology and leadership skills. Join us for an action-packed hour of fun and learning via videoconference.

We will have 2-3 prepared speeches from members. Speakers get candid, constructive and offers suggestions for improvement.
We will also practice answering impromptu questions during the Table Topics section of our meeting. Ever been tongue-tied when your boss asked you a question in a meeting? Table topics is a great way to practice the skills of thinking and speaking on the fly. You can join by computer, mobile app or phone. RSVP for the link to the videoconference. A meeting agenda will be sent to you the night before the meeting via messaging in Meetup.

events.name: *NOW ONLINE* Startup Speakers - Toastmasters Meeting
events.description_html:
**MEETING NOW ONLINE** Due to current events we will be hosting this and future meetings for the time being - online via Webinar and Zoom! Please keep up to date with your current country notices on COVID-19 and be aware that our host venue Plug N Play Tech Center in Sunnyvale has encouraged all guests to work and meet up remotely online. Please download the Zoom app on your computer or mobile device for FREE at Zoom.us and please RSVP ASAP to receive Zoom Meeting information via email prior to the meeting. Meeting dates and times to remain the same. Thank you for your understanding.

www.toastmasters.org/covid19

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Looking to improve your speaking and leadership skills? Ace a job interview 💪or pitch a VC 💰❓

➡️ You’ve come to the right place 👍

🎯 Startup Speakers is a Toastmasters Club. (What is Toastmasters? read below). Here you can work on your presentation and public speaking skills in a safe and welcoming environment. We meet early. Every Wednesday morning 🌅7:15 AM at Plug and Play in the Sierra Madre Meeting Room. Only early bird catches the worm 🐛🐦Guest speakers are welcome, please send us a message to make your pitch this next week 🗣

⏰ Be our guest 🤗and feel free to bring your own coffee, tea or snack! We also offer hot coffee ☕️ and bananas 🍌

Our schedule:

7:00 Networking
7:15 Start of Meeting
–––
1:15h long meeting:
• Invocator: Sets the tone
• 3 Speakers: Each Speaker has a prepared speech 5-7 minutes
• 3 Evaluators: Each Evaluator evaluates the prepared speakers
• Table Topics: Everybody can be asked to hold an impromptu speech
• Evaluation: Meeting is evaluated by Duty Masters & General Evaluator
• Awards: Best Speakers, Best Evaluator, Best Table Topics Speaker
–––
8:30 End of Meeting
***

About Toastmasters International

Toastmasters International is a nonprofit educational organization that teaches public speaking and leadership skills through a worldwide network of clubs.

Founded in October 1924, the organization currently has more than 280,000 members in 13,500-plus clubs in 116 countries.

For information about local Toastmasters clubs, please visit www.toastmasters.org

events.name: Writing Meditation w/ Davood Gozli
events.description_html:
Please sign-up here: www.thestoa.ca ... this is an online event.
The Zoom link and additional instructions will be emailed out to you an hour before the event.
Get updates @ https://thestoa.substack.com
More events @ www.thestoa.ca

***

Davood Gozli facilitates a writing session. Join this session if you have something to write (or would like to be given something to write about) and would like to have the support and accountability while writing it.

***

We’re living in uncertain times. The COVID-19 pandemic affects us all, and it’s becoming clear that we can’t depend on any one person or institution to make sense of our current crisis. In lieu of blindly reacting, how can we respond to this situation with wisdom?

Philosophy, dormant during times of relative certainty and ease, often comes to life just when it’s most needed. Once we admit, as Socrates urged, that we do not know what we thought we knew, this newfound knowledge of our own ignorance can help us begin to open ourselves up to what we can know together—and to how we can act in unison, based on that shared knowledge.

The Stoa was once a covered portico where Stoics met to philosophize. Now it’s a digital space, where we can gather and talk about what matters most right now, at the razor’s edge of this pandemic. Join us. Sign up to our mailing list for regular updates, gift what you can to support this project, and RSVP for upcoming sessions.

events.name: Limited Legal Personhood for AI
events.organiser: Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, and the Law
events.description_html:
Details
Dear Members: On April 22nd, Silicon Valley Law Group Shareholder Stephen Wu will host a Meetup webinar on "Limited Legal Personhood for AI" The guest speaker for the webinar will be John Frank Weaver. This Meetup is offered as a member benefit to Section members, although does not include CLE credits.
Our topic:
Nearly every law in the United States is built on an underlying assumption: only human beings make decisions. As autonomous technology, machine learning applications, and other forms of artificial intelligence (AI) become increasingly ubiquitous around us, that assumption becomes less true, causing tension between how we use technology and how legal models function. In this presentation, John Frank Weaver will discuss how granting limited legal personhood (similar to cities and corporations) to certain forms of AI addresses that tension and ensures that laws function properly. After explaining limited legal personhood and some of the problems inherent in regulating AI and any emerging technology, John will present situations where countries are already granting some forms of limited legal personhood to AI. From there, John will discuss key areas where the law does not properly address the functionalities of AI applications and how limited legal personhood can help.
Our speaker:
John Frank Weaver is an attorney with a practice focused on data privacy and emerging technology, including artificial intelligence. In a field where the law is frequently being made up on the fly, he counsels clients on existing and emerging regulations and best practices, as well as using data and technology governance to support their brand and customer engagement. He is the author of the book Robots Are People Too, which explores legal issues implicated by autonomous technology and AI, and a contributing writer at Slate magazine, where his articles have focused on similar issues. He is also a member of the board of editors and a columnist for The Journal of Robotics, Artificial Intelligence & Law. John is a sought after speaker on topics related to law and emerging technologies, and has been interviewed by The Atlantic, Consumer Reports, and the Wall Street Journal, among other media outlets.
Here is a link to the Zoom videoconference link to participate.
Join Zoom Meeting
https://zoom.us/j/988174151?pwd=amd0blV6aExsa1hqSUVzaE9mQWRRdz09
Once you click on the link, it will give you the option of viewing and listening to the program using your computer or dialing in to a phone number that the system will provide.
Slides: Zoom allows you to see the slides during the program, but we will also distribute a pdf of the slides by download afterwards.
We hope you can attend this talk and thank you for your interest.
Steve Wu

• Important to know: In light of the Coronavirus (COVID-19), this program will be a webinar-only event.

events.name: Adapting to a Post Covid-19 Business World
events.organiser: Network with Fashion Industry Professionals & Recruiters
events.description_html:
This is a webinar dedicated to hearing insight about adapting to a new world of business as a result of Covid-19. Our presenter, Kevin Williams, comes from an industry which might be possibly the most negatively affected by the Covid-19, Out-of-Home Entertainment. Kevin will discuss topics that pertain to multiple industries using his expertise on consumer behavior. While discussing lessons in history from previous "Black Swan" events.

MUST RSVP HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/adapting-to-a-post-covid-19-business-world-by-kevin-williams-tickets-102524950888 and you will get Zoom link on confirmation email

Topics/Main-points:
- Lessons on the impact Covid-19 has had on theme parks and leisure entertainment in China

- The new normal of out-of-home entertainment as China slowly reopens

- Lessons learned and borrowed from 2008 financial crisis as it pertains to the "Black Swan" of 2020.

- Short term solutions being used in today's business climate, and how it might impact negatively/positively business in the future.

About the Speaker:
Kevin Williams – a leading specialist in the digital Out-of-Home entertainment industry, through his consultancy KWP Limited, specializing in interactive entertainment. Coming from a long career in the theme park, amusement and entertainment software industries. Well known for his news service, The Stinger Report that has become a-must-read for those working or investing in the international market. Along with this, he is also a prolific writer with regular columns for the main trade publications in this market, along with presenting numerous conference sessions on the sector and its global impact. He is also the co-author of the only book on this aspect of the market, “The Out-of-Home Immersive Entertainment Frontier” – currently working on the next edition for 2021, scheduled for publication soon. Kevin can be reached at [masked].

events.name: Diversity and Inclusion in Fashion (Online Meetup)
events.description_html:
There’s no denying that, in its long and prominent history, the fashion industry has more often than not represented one standard of beauty. From catwalks to advertising campaigns, brands in days past have typically veered towards models of a typical build, age, and ethnicity – but we all know the world is a much richer tapestry. However, in recent years, the industry has been doing more to champion diversity, and we are seeing a much more inclusive approach to representation.

In the previous AFA Fashion Talk we discussed about how Covid-19 will influence Fashion Digital Marketing. During this new online Meetup, we will explore Diversity and Inclusion in Fashion through four talks. As usual, we will start with the presentations by senior students of their academic researches and we will end with the talk by an expert.

1. "The influences of Fashion Trends on Gender Roles", by Sabrina Marinus, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

2. "Cultural Appropriation and Fashion", by Gabriella Frempong, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

3. "Gender Neutral Fashion, Is There a Future?", by Quirine Galavazi, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

4. "Perspectives on Diversity and Inclusion in the Fashion Industry", by Giancarlo Pazzanese, lecturer of the Amsterdam Fashion Academy.

At the end of the four talks, you will have the opportunity to ask questions to the panelists.

Please, click on the link to register: https://luiss.webex.com/luiss/onstage/g.php?MTID=e017282e03b498828e710cbb1cc96c5ba

This Online Meetup has no costs. Feel free to invite guests!

Our Roundtable meetups

STARTING ON[masked]
Thursday’s 8:00pm to 8:40pm
Weekly

HERE’S THE PATH
Practice and do the work

IT COST TIME, WILL, PERSERVERANCE

MAX PLANCK one of the greatest minds.
“All matter originates and exists only by virtue of a force which brings the particle of an atom to vibration and holds this most minute solar system of the atom together. We must assume behind this force the existence of a conscious and intelligent mind. This mind is the matrix of all matter.”

ALBERT EINSTEIN

NIKOLA TESLA
“If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.”

You are the designer of your destiny; you are the author of your story.
Lisa Nichols
Is it a love story? RM

While we may love each other and never stop loving
each other, so often we stop "showing" each
other love.
Lisa Nichols

All the people in your life are truly doing the best they can with what they have. People can only love you to the capacity that they are able to love themselves. They can only forgive and embrace you to the capacity that they are able to forgive and embrace themselves. They can only give you what they have the capacity to give. You may think that you deserve more, and you may be correct. But that means nothing if a person simply doesn’t have the ability to give it to you.
Lisa Nichols,

Sent from my iPhone

events.name: FYI: Fashion Revolution LIVE Q&A on YouTube!
events.description_html:
Hello everyone!

I’m ONLY sharing NOT hosting!

Because we love secondhand style, I’m guessing that many of us are aware of the Fashion Revolution movement. Fashion Revolution aims to bring awareness and action to important social and environmental issues around fashion. April 20 - 26 is supposed to be the official FR week, but because of the global virus we are facing, many events have been put on line.

One of those events is a LIVE YouTube discussion on Friday, April 24 11:00-13:00 BST (I believe that is noon Zürich time) The title of the talk is:

Mass Consumption: The End of an Era?

“focus on the topic of mass production and consumption and its impact on our planet and the people who make our clothes.”

You can find access to the event through the Fashion Revolution YouTube channel. I think it will be a really interesting talk! You can find other events and lots of good information on their Instagram account and through their main site:

https://www.fashionrevolution.org

Again, I’m not hosting this. I’m merely using this planner to share all the info. Be sure to check out Fashion Revolution on Instagram, YouTube and their website for lots of good info!

I hope you are all well :)

We will chat again soon,
Elianne
