events.name: Stash busting sewalong, step 4: sewing up!
events.description_html:
If you're still with me on using a stash fabric or just want general support of your current sewing project here's the last part of this sewlong: sew it up!

If you finished your item long ago, how about making another one? The more of our stash fabrics we get through, the more experience we gain and the more satisfying the sewing process can become.

I must admit that I have not yet started the navy/cream velvet top I want to make - and that's because I am not sure that I picked a suitable pattern. I did start a sleeveless blouse with a different stash fabric (nothing to do with the velvet project just because I got the sudden urge). And I started a toile out of a newly bought and very cheap black jersey so I can evaluate the Lekala pattern I was going to use for my precious velvet. I also used a grey jersey fabric from my stash for a simple raglan sleeved top and now wonder if that mightn't be the best pattern for the velvet?

Every practical bit that I get to do teaches me what works and what doesn't. Unfortunately I often stop at the stage of "oh crikey I've run into a problem" and never picked the project back up. That gets very frustrating. It makes such a nice change this time: I threw myself into sewing with any fabric and any pattern that mysteriously made its way onto my sewing table. I will tackle the velvet, I promise!

What are you making, what kinds of stash fabric have you used recently and which do you think you might use next? Pictures please!

events.name: Meditation Session (Virtual)
events.description_html:
To secure your spot, purchase your ticket from the Eventbrite link (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/meditation-session-virtual-tickets-102188217710). RSVPing only on the Meetup page, doesn't allow you to attend the Event.

ABOUT THE EVENT

What a time we are in?! Uncertain, challenging, difficult and disturbing times. However, we need to settle down and not to panic. So many people are struggling to cope up the psychological strain and meditation would come in handy.

We used to host Meditation Happy Hours, where we meditate together and go our for drinks. Unfortunately, we could not do so, in the present situation. However, we migrated it to an online event. Our Coach gives us a brief run down of the event and leads the session. After the session we will get to socialize for few minutes.

When you purchase a ticket, you will be emailed the Event ID and Password.

Payment Instructions :

1. You should login from a PC to see the 'Pay Now' button, after RSVPing. Then hit the button.

2. Verify correct dollar amount for number of people you're paying for.

3. If you don't have a Paypal account, click "Pay with a Debit or Credit Card".

4. If you have a Paypal account, simply log in, and pay as you normally would via Paypal.

Refund & Ticket Resell

All sales are final. We only refund the full amount, if the event is canceled. If it is rescheduled, we will send an email to those who RSVPed 'YES' advising that. A full refund will be given to those that let us know within 2 calendar days of the update email, if you are unable to make it on the new date. No refunds will be given after that time.

However, you can sell your ticket to someone else if you are unable to attend. Please, feel free to post in the comment box for the event, that you have a ticket for sale. Work out payment between yourselves, and have the seller only send the organizer a message letting us know the full name of the person taking your spot. You must let us know two hours before the RSVP close time, on the day of the event.

events.name: Online/Virtual SPEED DATING (30s & 40s) NY Tri-State
events.description_html:
*REGISTER - https://www.weekenddating.com/event-details.aspx?id=7638#tix (our last one sold out quickly so if you'd like participate, please register ASAP)

Meet singles from the safety and comfort of your own home. This event is for Ages 30s & 40s who live or work in NY Tri-State area.

You will meet singles via your computer with webcam or smartphone/tablet (strong WiFi connection required if using a phone). The event will take place in a Virtual Room using Zoom (Zoom is a free download and super easy to use).

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We will break participants into pairs of two, just like we do with traditional speed dating. You will get to speak to each dates for a specified amount of time (typically 4-6 minutes). After the specified number of minutes, the guys will rotate to the next date and the process continues.

Just like with traditional speed dating, at the end of the event you will be able to let us know who you were interested in. We will send you both mutual matches (you picked them and they picked you) as well as one way matches (they picked you but you did not pick them).

You are given 20 minutes from the end of the event to let us know who you are interested in and will receive the results the same night (usually within one hour) or the next morning. You will not have to wait 24 hours or more to get your results.

The minimum number of potential dates will be 5 and the maximum will be about 10. If there are less than 5 members of the opposite sex in attendance, you would get credit for a future Virtual event.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How do I find the Virtual/Zoom Room?
After you purchase your ticket, you will get a confirmation appear on your screen along with the Zoom link for you to use to log in.

*To attend, get ticket at - https://www.weekenddating.com/event-details.aspx?id=7638#tix

*Cost is between $20-$25 depending on how early you register.

events.name: E tu cosa mangi?

Ciao ragazzi!
Vorrei condividere con voi un evento a cui tengo molto e che sono certo porterà risposte a molte delle domande più comuni riguardo la salute e il benessere.
Come sapete oltre all' allenamento c' è un altro aspetto fondamentale da considerare: siamo ciò che mangiamo (o che non mangiamo!).
Per questo motivo il prossimo mercoledì 22 Aprile alle ore 17 e per circa 45 minuti, con un gruppo di esperti realizzeremo una ZOOM gratuita per parlare di cibo e salute. Per fare chiarezza, prevenzione, sfatare miti e aiutarti a trovare la forma fisica desiderata.
Si parlerà di sovrappeso, obesità, diabete, problemi metabolici e ovviamente di soluzioni. Se conosci persone che soffrono di una di queste problematiche ti chiedo di farle un regalo: invitala a questa diretta. Se vuoi bene a questa persona fai in modo che sia informata.
Questo evento è solo su prenotazione. Alle persone interessate verrà dato un link per potersi connettere alla diretta via Zoom.
Rimango a disposizione per altre informazioni.
Buona giornata!

events.name: *SUSPENDED* Wednesday Night Run @ the Trailhead!
events.description_html:
*****
DUE TO THE SPREAD OF COVID-19, THIS WEEKLY GROUP RUN HAS BEEN SUSPENDED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

This a critical moment in the growing outbreak of COVID-19 in King County. Seattle & King County is working closely with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to protect the public's health.

We understand these actions will have a tremendous impact on all members of our community. These efforts are meant to slow the spread of novel coronavirus and reduce the number of people infected.
*****

Join the us for one of our rotating four-mile running routes! All paces are welcome! Every week, no matter what, we always hang out and socialize afterward at nearby Fremont Brewing, which has tasty craft beer and cider on tap, as well as some non-alcoholic options.

Check out our "subway map" that shows all of the routes, and the 2020 route schedule (https://goo.gl/DjtGey ) to see where we're running this week. Hosts Patrick, Yao, Chris, and Denise provide mini route maps and always make sure that everyone arrives safely back to port. If you're looking for something a little shorter, just ask us for some shortcut suggestions.

Despite what you see in the RSVP list, we typically have 15-30 runners each week, with many regulars who know the routes. Newbies are always welcome, as are any out-of-town runners looking for a fun group of runners!

We start meeting up at 5:15pm inside the Brooks Trailhead store at 3400 Stone Way in Seattle's Fremont neighborhood. At 5:35pm, we have introductions, describe the route, take a group photo, and head out the door. Most of our routes have a photo stop, usually about halfway, where we regroup. We return to the store, and then head over to Fremont Brewing.

In the winter months (November-February), please bring headlamps and reflective gear. In the summer months (June-August), bring a yoga mat if you like, as some of us join a free/donation yoga class at Gas Works Park after the run at 6:30pm. Occasionally, this run is paired with special activities at the store, such as meet-and-greets with Brooks-sponsored athletes or presentations by the Rock'n'Roll Marathon. And twice a year, we organize our own "adventure runs" throughout the neighborhood!

At the store, lockers with locks are provided for your stuff, and water and towels are available when we get back.

Dogs are welcome! We frequently have dogs with us during the run and at the dog-friendly brewery.

If you're thinking about bringing a jogging stroller, please ask us about this week's route. Some of our rotating routes are already stroller-friendly, some would need just a few minor adjustments, and some would be miserable-to-impossible. Hosts Patrick and Chris oftentimes run with strollers!

===================

If you're new to the Seattle Green Lake Running Group (SGLRG), the Wednesday Night Run is just one of our many regular weekly runs.

Monday Morning Track (5:30am)
Monday Evening Track (6:30pm)
Tuesday Evening Run (6:30pm)
Wake Up Wednesday (5:30am)
Wednesday Night Run (5:30pm)
Thursday Evening Casual Run (6:30pm)
Friday Lake Union Run (6:00am)
Saturday Morning Rise & Shine (7:00am)
Saturday Mid-Morning Run (9:00am)

Sunday runs depend on the week and rotate between trails, stairs, and easy.

See the entire SGLRG calendar here:
https://www.meetup.com/Seattle-Greenlake-Running-Group/events/calendar/

events.name: Lyrid Meteor Shower
events.description_html:
I enjoy looking at the night sky. Just this week there was an alignment of Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. I saw Venus clearly on Tuesday evening. But this is something so much more exciting.

Active from April 16 to April 25 this year, the Lyrid meteor shower is a long-running and occasionally incredible celestial event. Due to peak in the early hours of Wednesday, April 22, the Lyrids usually produce about 10 to 20 shooting stars per hour, though the shower has been known to sometimes produce hundreds for lucky onlookers. Each shooting star whizzes overhead at 30 miles per second, according to NASA. From your backyard, it should be possible to see some shooting stars produced by the Lyrid meteor shower just by stargazing outside if it’s a clear sky. The best way to see them is to simply go outside in the pre-dawn hours on April 22 — when the night-side of Earth is traveling head-first into the dust trails that cause the Lyrids. The radiant for this meteor shower is close to the constellation of Lyra, whose bright star Vega is easy to spot rising in the east, but shooting stars can occur anywhere in the sky. The best advice is to look generally east-southeast. Since the skies are dark, the nights before and after April 22 should be almost as good for catching a falling star or two.

events.name: The Embodied Yoga Summit   FREE 5-Day Conference ONLINE: APRIL 22nd-26th, 2020
events.organiser: EAST BAY RAW: Raw & Vegan Food & Health
events.description_html:
The Embodied Yoga Summit
FREE 5-Day Conference ONLINE: APRIL 22nd-26th, 2020

Are you ready to rediscover - and embody - your most vibrant self?
Join us to explore how reconnecting with the body and learning to move with awareness can promote a deeper level of health, happiness and inner well-being than you ever thought possible.

ENJOY A FANTASTIC LINE-UP OF 40+ EMBODIMENT RESEARCHERS & YOGA FACILITATORS IN THIS FREE ONLINE CONFERENCE

Exploring the power of embodied yoga to heal, transform and awaken yourself to the vibrancy of life. Sign up now and receive 10 FREE BONUSES plus access to several free live classes before the summit to support you through these difficult times.

Who's the conference for?
Yoga Students and Teachers of any level
Physical and Occupational Therapists
Mindfulness Practitioners
Parents, Teachers and Educators
Psychologists and Therapists
People who’ve hit a wall in their yoga practice and are looking for a fresh perspective
Any individual wanting to deeply connect with the inner landscape of their body and move with heightened awareness
Those looking to open themselves to a new experience of yoga, no matter their current discipline
People with an interest in incorporating somatic methods into their practice
Anyone looking to fulfill the highest expression of themselves and bring a new dimension of joy into their lives
Anyone wanting to be in a like-minded community engaged in yoga, embodiment practices, and movement

During the event you’ll discover:
Increased physical strength, flexibility and ease
Healing yourself and others from trauma stored in the body
Direct ways to prevent and relieve chronic pain
Tools for addressing unhelpful and limiting physical and psychological patterns
How to incorporate somatic methods into your yoga practice
New techniques for deepening your meditation
How to build self-esteem, experience an enhanced sense of belonging, and create a deeper sense of connection to yourself and others
The connection between yoga, embodiment, and social justice
Becoming a part of this revolution that is Embodiment (coming home to the body), and how it can truly transform our lives and the world!
Strength, ease and flexibility await… from the inside out.

events.name: Coffee & Inspiration online event (Free)
events.description_html:
In these times, it is important to celebrate the little things. Even though we cannot meet in person we can still cultivate our love for coffee. What better way to do this than by learning how to make great coffee at home from a pro who can also share some great life lessons? Please join us for an interactive online session as we hear from Donny Raus, founder of Raus Coffee.

Bring your lunch, coffee, questions with you for what will be an informative and inspirational meetup.

Zoom details to be provided upon RSVP. And please feel free to invite your friends!

A bit about Donny:
Donny Raus has been active in the coffee community for 14+ years. Having worked in various capacities, from barista to an educator and roaster, one thing has always rung true, coffee and people have always been his passions.
In college he worked for Starbucks and was selected to become one of the company’s first certified coffee specialist with the title "Coffee Master". Later taking a job in corporate accounting and brought his coffee with him, literally. Armed with an espresso maker, drip coffee pot, and a half a dozen single origin coffees, his office became the meeting spot for company executives to get a great cup of coffee. 
While still at Starbucks he started the “Free Pour Mailing List”, the company's first comprehensive mailing list to include new product highlights, coffee tastings and pairing notes, equipment reviews, and subscriber Q&A. He also spent his time traveling the region presenting “Coffee Talk”, an educational series on coffee and was commended by the company’s President.
In 2005 he left Starbucks, as well as, the corporate world and in 2007 he founded the Connecticut Coffee Society, educating all who wanted to learn about the magic beverage through cupping. That same year he was elected President of the Northeast Regional Roasters Group, in charge of organizing the group's annual roasters retreat, where he served a term of 3-years.
Deciding there wasn’t anything he’d rather do, in October 2007 took a leap of faith and started Raus Coffee Company, where he aims to make a difference by doing what he loves, coffee.

https://www.rauscoffee.com

https://m.facebook.com/donnyraus

events.name: What's on Your Fork? 5 ways it impacts the Earth and what you can do to help

events.description_html:
The power to care for the Earth is in our hands…and on the ends of our forks. This Earth Day, join in for a free one hour webinar to learn about how decisions about your diet can make a difference for our planet.

In this interactive and lively webinar, Rev. Beth Love of Eat for the Earth will share about our diets, perhaps the least discussed lifestyle factor that is implicated in many of our most pressing environmental issues. Learn what the research says about the most and least environmentally-friendly foods, the relative impact of production methods versus consumption patterns, and the changes in global human diets that could preserve the habitability of our planet. Get your questions answered. Find out how you can support the integration of global human diets into broader environmental conversations and actions.

Note, you can RSVP "yes" here on Meetup to indicate your intent to participate. Please register on our Eventbrite site to be sure you are in the loop for videoconference login information: https://whats-on-your-fork.eventbrite.com.

events.description_html:
Strong Arm of the Law(Part 11)

The group retraced the steps of the fleet footed rogue to arrive at the same dead end. After determining the "doorways to nowhere" needed more powerful magic to be activated the group headed back to the room with the marble statues. The group split-up to explore different rooms to see what could be found or discovered. The monk went into the well lit room just a few steps from the statue room and found carved images & a strange globe w/ pointer but didn't determine its purpose if any. Other members went into the large room with a grass floor, not odd for a underground temple, and found a nice fountain, fresh dirt to dig in and a few different statues. After the rogue defaced a statue,even after being warned, the guardians came to life. The seated statues opened their boxes and floating heads arose. The Paladins' amazingly avoided the devastating special attacks and the Oracle finished off the final threat posed by the guardians. While resting in the wizards floating dimensional motel the monk noticed a familiar figure appear. Nirena strode below unaware of the groups presence. She checked the aftermath of the encounter then returned to the vampire looking statue. The monk witnessed the activation process to acquire the planar tuning fork. Will the adventurers follow? Was Nirena deliberate in showing this? Will they say enough is enough and return to collect their rewards from Venture Captain Obo?

Pathfinder- Level 9/Fast Adv/All Races & Classes

Part 10- 3,500 XP

April 22nd 5:30pm

Zoom and Roll20 links will be sent before the session

events.name: Old School D&D Open Table Online Delve
events.description_html:
What it is:
This is session 27 of our Open Table delve into the Barrowmaze.

Due to the current state of restricted contact due to coronavirus, we'll be moving sessions online until we can meet again in person.

We're planning to play via Zoom (https://zoom.us/). You'll need a free account and client (there are downloadable clients as well as browser-based) and we'll post the link to the meeting before the game starts.

Barrowmaze is a modern old school dungeon filled with danger and treasure. There's an emerging story to discover, but plenty of fun to be had if you'd just prefer to show up, grab a character sheet, kick in the door and try to make it out with fortune and glory.

The game rules:
We are using a freely available rule set that will be immediately familiar to anyone who has played Basic / Expert D&D, or AD&D, and is easily approachable without nothing but a desire to learn for those new to fantasy RPGs. See the links to the Basic Fantasy RPG rules in the message board if you'd like to read up beforehand.

What to bring:
You need bring nothing but a set of dice and a desire to have a fun night, whether you play once or every time.

Misc:
We continue to have a great time meeting new folks and seeing familiar faces interested in discovering or already into old school gaming!

events.name: (The ruins of the) Yawning Portal
events.organiser: Baltimore Maryland Dungeons and Dragons Adventure League
events.description_html:
Session 98.5

Through the Arch Gate

Upon opening the door to leave the Githyanki barracks, the party encountered a large contingent of Ettins and Duergar. These lesser enemies were no match for the party and were dispatched with relative ease.

Heading back to the mind flayer lair, the party encountered a pair of flumphs that took a liking to Groot and agreed to help the group if they could mark the paladin with their scent. Trenifee convinced Groot to allow the flumphs to mark his shield, which left a foul stench emanating from him.

The flumphs used their tentacles to manipulate the Qualith (the braille-like writing) doors and the group moved through about the lair. They found a large number of crystalline cylinders containing various humanoids in some type of suspended animation. The group couldn't quite figure out how to disable the cylinders and left the area in hopes of possibly finding a solution further in.

The party encountered a pair of Ulitharid and more Ettins in a large, long hallway. Through Marinus' manipulation of a nearby underground river, and with party picking off the creatures from range, this group, too, was defeated.

Further in the lair the group found a room containing a statue and an inactive arch gate, the gate depicting three stick-figures holding hands. Four party members linked up hands on the far side of the room and were promptly hit with a Prismatic Spray spell from the statue. Gia investigated the statue and surmised the covering it in Darkness would alleviate it's ability to 'see' the group. Trenifee provided the spell and three members linked hands next to the gate and it activated.

The group stepped through into a room containing furniture made entirely of bone and skin, though free of enemies. Gia set up a magic mansion and the group took a much-needed rest.

***CHECK GROUP MESSAGE FOR ADDITIONAL DETAILS***

events.name: Celebrate Earth Day
events.organiser: Girls who like girls who like to hike!
events.description_html:
2020 brings the 50th Celebration of Earth Day! We have all had to adapt during the last few weeks so we wanted to provide some ideas on how we can celebrate Earth Day this year while keeping our social distance. We encourage you to share with a friend, post to your socials, and share a photo or words below how you celebrated Earth Day this year!

1. Try a new vegetarian recipe
2. Go for a bike ride
3. Watch a nature documentary
4. Hug a tree- literally
5. Plant some seeds
6. Follow the National Park Service on Facebook/ Instagram
7. Tree Pose -outdoor yoga
8. Write a poem about our planet
9. Visit the San Diego Zoo's web cams
10. Walk barefoot in the grass
11. Do a home energy use assessment
12. Pick up trash in your neighborhood
13. Draw a picture of a tree, a flower, the beach
14. Read up how to finally start that compost pile
15. Check out I Love A Clean San Diego website
16. Do some cloud watching
17....

Feel free to share your own ideas on how to love Mother Earth while keeping at least 6ft from your fellow earthlings!

events.name: Tantra Chat hosted by Jason and Ingo - A Free & Online Programme
events.organiser: Tantra for Gay / Bi Men - New York
events.description_html:
This is a live and interactive session guided by Jason and Ingo for 90mins. You are warmly invited to join us in this Live event. If you are not able to make it, we will post a recording of the event in the App for you. We will offer more future sessions and our aim is always to try alternate timezones so that it is mainly accessible to the USA and the next time in Europe.

In this session Jason and Ingo will talk about topic related to Tantra. They will give you some of their ideas, some practices and some meditations that you can take away and try them out.

This is an interactive session, so please come and attend and be up for taking part. The beauty of this session is that it is interactive. So please bring us your questions about anything related to your life or to Tantra. Maybe talk to us about any problems or issues that you’d like to explore, or things you are not sure about, maybe ask the questions you never dare to ask. Maybe you want to share your experience and see if there are any insights that we can offer? Here is a place where all of your questions, things you are struggling with, ideas that you want, all of that is on offer in this call.

Please be aware that if you choose to join this call it will be recorded and posted in to the App only so that other members can catch up afterwards. By attending the group call you agree to this being recorded and being shared within the app.

The purpose of these sessions is to help stimulate conversation on different ideas in Tantra. The aim is to make it interactive and to make it about you. Jason and Ingo are not therapists and are not medically trained. Any questions, reflections or ideas are offered from our perspective as Tantra Teachers with the aim of helping you to gain a deeper understanding, or, to give you some ideas of how you might explore the different topics that you bring. The questions or ideas offered, you accept these of your own volition and if at any point you want us to stop, please do let us know. Our only role is to support your enquiry, support you deepening your understanding of what's going on and and to explore where Tantra may support you.

Often by listening to others ideas, or things they are struggling with, you can help see how it relates to you and to the areas in your own life that you are working on.

At the beginning of the call we will ask for those that would like sometime to ask questions or to explore anything related to the topic. We will offer those spaces on a 1st come 1st served basis and it might be that we do not have time to talk to talk to everyone, but we will do our best.

This is a great way to meet Jason and Ingo and to experience our work and ideas to see if it resonates for you. It might be that you would then like to explore Tantra more deeply by attending one of their live in person events.

If being at home is making you feel restless or disconnected, yoga may help you to feel more energised and grounded. With this online class we are hoping to provide a safe place for our community to do yoga together.

Instructor Allison will lead a gentle session appropriate for all fitness/experience levels.

To best take advantage of the class, you will need a space on your floor big enough to lie down and a blanket, a yoga mat or a big towel, a tie or dressing gown belt and some kind of block – a thick book will do.

How to join?

events.name: The Sensual Self-Touch Workshop with R. Ayité Okyne - A Free & Online Programme
events.organiser: Tantra for Gay / Bi Men - New York
events.description_html:
In this time of quarantining, staying at home, isolation and social distancing, many of us are feeling very touch-deprived and skin-hungry. This is because as humans, we are social animals and hardwired for touch.

Since we cannot gather in person for group cuddle sessions, I'd like to offer a virtual self-touch session. I know many of us are single and may not get opportunities for touch. I will be taking us through a self-touching ritual that we can do on our own. In this workshop, we will experience and experiment with various types of touch.

The session will be clothing-optional so you can have greater skin access. Just remember this about being SENSUAL, not sexual.

You will want to set your space up to create a warm, welcoming environment (candles, dim lights, aromatherapy scents are good). You can choose to be seated comfortably, or to lie down. If you have it, have some massage oil or other oil handy. Also useful to have would be some of your favorite textures - faux furs, your favorite blanket, silks, merino wool...you decide.

Please join in early to prevent disruptions during our session.

Feel free to send me a message if you have any questions.

The session will only be 40 minutes because I'm trying out the Zoom platform and 40 minutes is the limit it has on basic accounts. Depending on how popular the virtual program is, I will consider purchasing a premium plan. If you don't have Zoom already, please consider downloading it ahead of time. This will be a video-on session, so we can see everyone. I will NOT be recording the session and ask that no-one tries to record it either.

events.name: Brooklyn 4th Wednesday Bisexual+ Social & Discussion Group by BiRequest
events.organiser: NYC Tri-State Area Bisexual+ SGL Queer & Questioning Meetup
events.description_html:
***VIRTUAL MEETING INFO***
Zoom: https://us04web.zoom.us/j/445643942
Meeting ID:[masked]

Join BiRequest's Social and Discussion group for ALL who self identify as Bisexual+, Biromantic+, MSpec (Multi-gender Attraction Spectrum) and otherwise Queer-identified or Questioning regardless of Labels or the Lack of them ... for ALL folx of every Gender & Gender Presentation including but not limited to Cis, Genderfluid, Intersex, Nonbinary, Trans, and more at our regular Brooklyn Meetings held every 3rd Friday of each month from 6-8 pm at the Brooklyn Community Pride Center a part of the Bed-Stuy Restoration Center complex, and a short walk from the Nostrand Avenue A·C subway stop, & the B44 or B43 bus lines to Fulton Ave (https://goo.gl/maps/2U8hf8QsdB62).

The meetings are Moderated and focused on a Discussion Topic that is generated with input from the folks around the circle (nb. we do also hold space for folks who might need to deal with an issue in the moment).

We work hard to foster a safe space for non-judgemental peer support while actively valuing racial and gender diversity, sex- and body-positivity, as well as the litany of intersecting identities that folks walk into the room embracing. We welcome spouses and allies to join us at our twice-monthly meetings to discuss a topic around issues related to our lived experiences as “the silenced majority” in the LGBTQ+ realm.

CW: Please note that BiRequest discussions can involve sensitive topics. For anyone who is triggered by anything in the discussion or needs to discuss a personal matter, multiple BiRequest facilitators will be available at the meetings. Please talk to one of us.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
▼ About Us
BiRequest (www.birequest.org) has existed in one form or another, serving the New York City metropolitan area, since the early 1990's. We're a community-based support and discussion group serving the metro NYC area... all volunteer run, open to bi+ identifying folx and our allies.

We're all folx who've been there. We know what it's like to be ostracized, set aside and erased as bisexual people. We are folx who identify as pansexual, same-gender loving people, sexually and affectionately fluid. We are the B in LGBT.

We are a multi-racial and many gendered and variously sex'd people. We are uniquely challenged and able in many different ways. We work towards the realization of our collective liberation.

▼ Follow Us Online
☛ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BiRequest
☛ Twitter: https://twitter.com/birequestnyc

▼ Join the discussion!
☛ We meet in Manhattan, at NYC's LGBT Community Center on West 13th Street on the 1st Monday and 3rd Thursday of every month.
☛ We meet in Brooklyn, at Brooklyn's LGBT Community Center off Fulton Street near the Restoration Plaza on the 3rd Friday of every month.

▼ On the social side!
Join us for cocktails... or come for a movie night

☛We meet for no-agenda socials at a rotation of queer bars on the 2nd Wednesday and 4th Friday of every month.
☛ We meet as movie lovers and queer eyes on the 2nd Tuesday of every month.

We're always looking for events and activities to gather us all together. Wanna help?? Email us! info (at) BiRequest (dot) org

Like what we do? Interested in helping create other social events? Please let us know, and we'll get to work to build an even stronger bi+ community in NYC.

▼ BiRequest a place where the Bi+ Community meets in NYC! ▼

Learn the best technique and compound moves (muscle building), get more confident in the privacy of your own home while still feeling part of the community!

If you are not, please send us a short description as to why you wish to attend our meeting. It is vitally important we do not put our attendees at any risk. Our spaces are safe spaces and we do not tolerate any homophobia, transphobia or biphobia.

Once the meeting is full, we will be happy to add an additional gathering or look to expanding numbers as we go.

By participating you acknowledge any online activity is impossible to guarantee privacy.

We look forward to this being a positive experience and look forward to talking with you!

Stay safe and well at home.

events.name: Online: Unlock Humor & Resilience in Hard Times Webinar
events.description_html:

Register: https://challenger-point.com/unlock-tour-2020

Calling all those who have mental grit, fortitude, tenacity, and perseverance, along with those who could use a boost!

In the midst of a sudden global Coronavirus pandemic, loss of income, employment, housing, health, loved ones, business goals, contracts, and events, with widespread fear and anxiety, along with increasing acts of violence, suicides, wars, natural disasters, personal hardships, and adversities galore, we can all stand to learn more about resilience, band together, share resources, and what helps you personally and professionally.

These webinar workshops cover: What is resilience? What strategies help to quickly adapt to major disruptions in personal life and work? What skills can I practice? What role does humor play? Plus ways to get involved, share what helps you, and share local, state, and national resources.

This project is a humanitarian effort on behalf of Matthew William, who has lived with depression and PTSD, is a retired firefighter from Oshtemo, Michigan, licensed trauma and addiction counselor in Winter Park, Colorado. Matthew is a Multisport Ministries endurance athlete, Cathexis Talent model and actor, and the founder of Challenger Point Practice & Apparel.

We aim to create a collective community of resilience building individuals and organizations. Sign up for one or all events.

events.name: Between Men - online!
events.description_html:
While we may be physically distant, we don't need to be socially distant. Until such time as Outlink's office reopens, we will be hosting our regular peer support groups through Zoom, an online platform that support audio, video, and text based communication.

Between Men is a group for men who are gay, bi, trans, queer, questioning their sexuality, or who otherwise have sex with men. Non-binary folks who see themselves reflected in this space are absolutely welcome to attend. It is a safe space where we can talk openly and honestly.

Together we can work towards making sense of our sexualities and genders and the ways they impact us. Together we can realize our individual strengths and sort through the negative views of ourselves we've been picking up since we first realized we were different. When Between Men meets, we will have the chance to share our experiences and our struggles. We will be heard and feel important. We will help each other liberate ourselves from our pain. Besides all the serious stuff. we will socialize and meet new people, having fun among supportive and safe company.

Please note that this meeting is moderated by Outlink staff/volunteers who reserve the right to remove anyone from the group who is in violation of our Safer Space Ground Rules (available on our website).
This meetup is intended as a space for peer support and casual connection. This is not a structured therapy group nor is it a dating space. If you are looking for further support, Outlink staff are available to meet with you one-on-one or in small groups by phone, text based messaging, or video call upon request. They can also help connect you to other counselling services.

-----

events.name: What kind of a community communication hub do we want?
events.description_html:
What technologies do we want already in place when we're stuck in an emergency? A web hub like sonomacounty.recovers.org? A network of HAM and FRS Radios? Teenagers going house to house on bicycles? All of the above? What actions do we need to take to make our preferred solution happen? Who is going to implement it? This is my suggested discussion topic for our next Code for Sonoma video conference get together. What would **you** like to talk about? Do we need a guest presenter? Post your suggestions and we can change to your topic for this next meeting or add it to a future agenda.

Meeting Format:

12:00-12:30 Greetings and Self Introductions
12:30-1:00 Speaker or set-up for discussion
1:00 - 1:30 Topical discussion
1:30 - 1:45 Choose topic for next meeting
1:45 - 2:00 Schedule meeting and recruit co-host
2:00 -- Conference site available for further chit chat

My vision is that this Code for Sonoma County group, possibly meeting conjointly with West Sonoma County Techies and maybe WIMP and/or Chimera, will continue to meet for general discussions until an idea for a specific project surfaces. Then a team will self-organize and hold separate working sessions. Each team will report their progress to the main group from time to time and will present their project prototype to the group if/when they are ready.

events.name: Making Calls to our Legislators to Act 4 Change (over Zoom)
events.description_html:
At our first Act 4 Change meeting on 3/28, some folks decided they wanted support and motivation to call our legislators by doing it at the same time. We call to ask for various things that we want them to support, and/or to complain or make suggestions, etc. At the beginning of the meeting, we will answer questions (practice?) then get calling at the same time (on mute and with speakers off). All are welcome to join us. We are stronger together.

We use a growing Google spreadsheet that includes current action plans, groups to join, podcasts that inform us about actions we can take, and groups doing great work already that we can engage with. (We get many of our actions from SURJ Boston emails.) This sheet is provided during these meetings.

ZOOM:
The Zoom link will be posted in the comments a day or so before the meeting. A password will be included. Deb will only let in folks that RSVP here. Please check in and download Zoom in advance if you haven't used it before.

***

FYI, about the Act 4 Change monthly meeting:
We meet to share knowledge about actions one can/did take (alone or with a group), to share experience and get support with doing actions, and learn skills for taking actions. We come together to focus on taking action now to make systemic changes for racial justice.

We meet regularly on the third Saturday of each month. So plan your activities around this and join us. Now is the time to act for change!

Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.

Nate Woods (pictured) was executed/lynched last night (3/5/20) in Alabama. He was innocent, just in the wrong place at the wrong time. Along with many other folks, I made a few actions to help stop his execution, but it wasn't enough. This is my motivation for starting a monthly Knapsack meeting with a focus on taking action. (https://thenorthstar.com/shaun-king-an-innocent-man-is-scheduled-to-be-lynched-today-in-alabama/)

- Find your Massachusetts legislator:
https://malegislature.gov/Search/FindMyLegislator

events.name: There There: listen together to the audio book: 5/9 (over Zoom)
events.description_html:
Join us to listen to this book on audio book! After saying "hi" we will turn off our videos and mute so we can listen while we cook, eat, clean, rest...whatever you want to do. The audio book is 8 hours long (but we are taking 9 meetings to get to it all) so we plan to meet 4 more times for an hour. We will plan next reading times together...with those that attend.

* Please try to be on time or a little early so we can listen for a full hour.

We'll discuss the book on May 13th. You don't need to listen with us. You can get the book and read it on your own. This is an option for those who might find it hard to get the book while the libraries are closed, or just to be "together" with others while listening.

"This is the first novel by Cheyenne and Arapaho author Tommy Orange. Published in 2018, it opens with an essay by Orange as a prologue, and then proceeds to follow a large cast of Native Americans living in the area of Oakland, California, as they struggle with a wide array of challenges ranging from depression and alcoholism, to unemployment, fetal alcohol syndrome, and the challenges of living with an ethnic identity of being "ambiguously nonwhite." All coalesce at a community pow wow and its attempted robbery.

"The book explores the themes of Native peoples living in urban spaces (Urban Indians), and issues of ambivalence and complexity related to Natives' struggles with identity and authenticity. There There was favorably received, and was a finalist for the 2019 Pulitzer Prize. The book was also awarded a Gold Medal for First Fiction by the California Book Awards."
source for above: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/There_There_(novel)
(sorry, I couldn't find the author's website, my preference, Deb)

All are welcome.

ZOOM:
The meeting code will be posted in the comments on this page before the meeting. Only folks who RSVP will be let in from the "waiting room." Please join the call 5 minutes before the official meeting start time to make sure you can get on the call. We want to start listening to the book as soon as possible. Put a comment on this page if you are having problems getting in. (Please download Zoom in advance if you haven't used it before.)

events.name: CivicTechWR Hacknight #56: Hacking from a Social Distance
events.description_html:
How's everyone doing? After a brief hiatus we're back at it! Let's connect over Google Hangouts this week and check in. There will be a demo of the Digital Storytelling Project, a discussion of ongoing projects and then a breakout into groups for project specific work. Everyone is welcome -- all skills, interests, talents, etc.! Come and join.

What's a CivicTechWR Hacknight?
We meet every 2 weeks, usually alternating between speaker sessions and working sessions. At our speaker sessions, we host a leader from the community to speak to the group. This could be someone from a local non-profit, from government, from industry, or any citizen - what matters is that they have something to discuss with our group, something to teach us, or something to inspire us. During both our speaker sessions and our hacknights, we provide space and time for people to work together on civic tech projects. This event is one of those project-only hacknights.

What to bring:
Your ideas, your skills, a collaborative spirit.

What is CivicTechWR?
CivicTechWR brings together people from different sectors and industries to actively solve issues facing our local community. We welcome people with all types and levels of skills. Even though "tech" is in the name, everyone is welcome and everyone has a skill or experience that is valuable. We're here to empower people to work together, exchange ideas and tools to improve the lives of the residents in and around Waterloo Region through civic technology.

events.name: Labor, Tech, and COVID-19: a virtual discussion with Wendy Liu
events.description_html:
How is the COVID-19 shutdown impacting workers and organizing in the technology industry?

Join guest speakers Wendy Liu, author of the new book 'ABOLISH SILICON VALLEY: How to Liberate Technology from Capitalism', and Meredith Whittaker, Google walkout organizer and co-director and co-founder of AI Now, to discuss labor and tech practices in a time of crisis with Data & Society economist and postdoctoral researcher Brian Callaci.

In addition to describing the structural factors of the economy that gave rise to Silicon Valley as we know it, Liu’s book proposes a more radical way of developing technology, where innovation is conducted for the benefit of society at large rather than to enrich a select few. Pre-order a copy here:
https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/622177/abolish-silicon-valley-by-wendy-liu/

Potential conversation starters:

What is the relationship between outsourcing supply chains and Silicon Valley, both historically and in the current pandemic?

How do charismatic (and often hubristic) CEOs influence policy and perspectives? How are industry leaders reacting to the rapidly shifting the balance between labor and management, including the stakes of even going to work in person?

How does one organize tech workers and build solidarity between programmers, low-wage workers, and other stakeholders in new technologies? Why does the misclassification of workers matter?

We welcome your questions, too!

Wednesday, April 22, 2020 from 6-7pm ET.
Please RSVP for Zoom link and shared resources: https://datasociety.net/events/labor-tech-and-now/

events.name: (#18) Race and Mental Health [Online Event]
events.organiser: Durham Identification of & Solutions to Racism Meetup Group
events.description_html:
Hello Everyone!

For our next event we are going to continue using a virtual group discussion format via the Jitsi Meet App. During our next racism discussion group meeting we will discuss race and mental health.

Here are some of the questions that we will discuss during the meeting, but we will not be limited to:

1. How would you define mental health? What falls under the mental health umbrella?

2. What impacts do you think racism has had on the mental health of the people of the United States of America?

3. Do you believe there are differences in the quality of mental health care that minority patients receive as has been well documented in the physical health context?

4. Do black people and white people have different mental health needs? If so, why do you believe those differences exist?

5. Do you have a story about yourself, someone else, or something that was depicted in media that reminds you of the widely agreed upon taboo of addressing mental health issues in minority communities?

The group discussion starts at 7pm. The Jitsi Meet App link will be made available to everyone that RSVPs for this event. We hope to see you there!

events.name: Evicted by Greed Meetup: Eviction in Times of Crisis
events.description_html:
EVICTED BY GREED Meetup: Eviction in Time of Crisis.

Part of the DNL Activation Programme https://www.disruptionlab.org/meet-ups

Wednesday 22 April, 19:00, online streaming.

The event is free of admission and the number of participants. Booking is essential.
To register, please write to [masked] with your name and we will send you the link to join the online call.

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Since the corona pandemic, issues of affordable housing and speculation are as pressing as never before. How are activists in the city dealing with the current crisis? How are they restructuring their work and keep fighting for affordable housing for all, and what is happening to stop evictions in times where people are urged to stay at home?
Warming up to our online conference EVICTED BY GREED: Global Finance, Housing & Resistance (29-31 May 2020 - https://www.disruptionlab.org/evicted-by-greed), we invite you to join a collective discussion with two collectives working on housing issues.

The Syndikat collective, who has been running their Neukölln bar since 1985, will share the story of how they uncovered the ownership structures of their building, and how this brought them to a letterbox with 75 other names in Luxembourg. Also, they will give an update on the situation around their eviction that was previously planned for 17 April 2020. The Bündnis Zwangsräumung verhindern will speak about how they work on stopping forced evictions in Berlin, especially in these difficult times.

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Programme – Starting from 19:00
• Introduction of participants
• Talk by Syndikat collective on their research
• Talk by Bündnis Zwangsräumung verhindern on their work
• Collective discussion

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Syndikat is a collectively self-organised neighbourhood bar that has existed in Neukölln's Schillerkiez since 1985. In the summer of 2018, Syndikat received an eviction notice, and supporters began the search for the actual figure behind the Luxembourg letterbox company to which the building at Weisestraße 56 belongs – at least on paper. They encountered not only a vast network of dozens of shell companies, but also the beneficiary of the entire construct: Pears Global, until that point a still-undiscovered but major player on the Berlin real estate market. The eviction of the Syndikat bar was originally planned for 17 April 2020, but has for now been cancelled for that day.
https://syndikatbleibt.noblogs.org/

Bündnis Zwangsräumung Verhindern [Stop Evictions]
The Stop Evictions alliance has been struggling since 2012 through many forms of civil disobedience for the right of housing and forced evictions. In recent years displacement of people on lower incomes from the city centre has become a sad reality. The process is similar to many other cities, the speculative strategies of private owners, real estate and public housing companies who are trying to extract the maximum profit from their houses. Our group strives for a society based on mutual aid and solidarity, and organizes diverse and public protest against this together with those who have been affected.
https://www.facebook.com/zwangsraeumungverhindern/

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++

The Disruption Network Lab Activation program is kindly supported by the Guerrilla Foundation. The ‘Tactics of Empowerment’ series is funded by the Senatsverwaltung für Kultur und Europa (Senate Department for Culture and Europa, Berlin), Bundeszentrale für politische Bildung (bpb) , The Reva and David Logan Foundation (grant provided by NEO Philanthropy) and the Checkpoint Charlie Foundation / Checkpoint Charlie Stiftung. Supported [in part] by a grant from the Foundation Open Society Institute in cooperation with the OSIFE of the Open Society Foundations. Part of Re-Imagine Europe, co-funded by the Creative Europe programme of the European Union.

events.name: The Issues You Don't Talk About Cafe Monthly Meetup
events.organiser: The Issues You Don't Talk About Cafe
events.description_html:
This Meetup is about the sharing of ideas in a public and open forum where participants can come to learn and teach. In order for people to feel comfortable expressing their, what may be controversial, views we aim to create an environment that is not absent passion, but is cordial to people who may even have extreme views. It is incumbent upon all participants to contribute in fostering that environment.

The Meetup is divided into three consecutive sessions:
I. One Minutes - An icebreaker. We go around the room and ask each person to state their first name and then talk about anything that is on their mind for approximately one minute.

II. Topical discussion - The heart of the Meetup where we put a topic on the table and ask those who choose to share any opinion or idea around the topic. We informally toss around a stuffed animal which serves as a "talking stick." When you have it in your possession you have the floor. We loosely spend about 15 minutes on each topic depending on the number of people in attendance. This is not the time for debate, but there is room for anyone to ask some clarifying questions of the speaker in order to better understand their point of view. The goal is not to change minds in this section, but to give those minds food for thought.

III. Meetup after the Meetup - This is the end of the "formal" Meetup and where the healthy debate can take place. With smaller groups we passionately argue things that we may have talked about in topical discussion to everything else on the planet. Some say this is the best part and some people loathe the passion and the volume. Some leave before or during this part and others show up just for it. It can last for hours.

If there are rules to this Meetup, these are them:

BE RESPECTFUL TO EVERYONE regardless of their views on any subject.
Bring your voice and passion, but leave your anger and condescension at home.
If you get angry at differing opinions, please realize that this is not the place for you and kindly do not attend.
Eat, drink and be merry and tip well if you can.
We don't have to leave as friends, but we can't leave as enemies.

As usual there is a lot to talk about. Here are some of the topics we could explore:

Do you take your relationship(s) for granted? Can that be a good thing? Should your children take your love for granted?

Does President Trump really want a second term? What makes you think so?

Was President Trump taking to foreign officials about a political rival an impeachable offense?

The Black New Channel is launching in November of this year. What do you think about that? The Chairman is former GOP Congressman J.C. Watts.

What happens if all the fears that have been foretold come true with respect to climate change? Will our children experience a drastically different world than the one we live in now? If so, will that world be necessarily better or worse? Or just different?

Warren has passed up Biden in a national poll. Is this a good thing?

Is talking about religion becoming unfashionable?

I look forward to talking to you all.

Glenn

events.name: Daily Morning Meditation (Zazen) at Two Arrows Zen, Monday - Friday
events.organiser: Two Arrows Zen - Artspace Zendo, Salt Lake City
events.description_html:
You are warmly welcome to join Michael Mugaku Zimmerman Roshi and the Two Arrows Zen sangha for morning meditation, Monday through Friday.

There are two sitting periods: 7:00 - 7:35 am, and 7:45 - 8:15 am. Meditation cushions and chairs are provided. No prior experience with meditation is required. You may join for one period, or for both. If it is your first time, please come a few minutes before the first sit so we can provide a little orientation.

On Tuesday mornings, the second sitting period is the Morning Service, when we chant the core texts of our practice: The Heart Sutra, the Identity of Relative and Absolute, and the Enmei Jukku Kannon Gyo in celebration of Kanzeon, the Bodhisattva of Compassion. There's incense and bells, full bows, and you'll probably see a few folks in robes.

Arrive a little early for coffee or tea if you need a wake-up. After sitting, we offer a friendly bowl of oatmeal and conversation every morning before you go on to the rest of your day.

Membership is required after your first month; donations are always welcome. (Donation is $5 per day or Two Arrows Meditator Membership ($30/month.)

Street clothing is fine; we take off shoes in the zendo. No shorts or tank tops, please. Please arrive on time to be settled in the zendo 5 minutes before the sit begins.

Two Arrows Zen is closed for major holidays and for our Winter and Spring Sesshins. Please check the Calendar for the program on specific dates. https://www.twoarrowszen.org/calendar/

We're looking forward to seeing you in the zendo!

p.s. for more formal meditation instruction, consider coming to A Day of Zen for meditation and teaching. You'll find more information at https://www.twoarrowszen.org/programs-retreats/

events.name: Joy Is A "Social Distanced" Earth Day Nature Walk & Trash Pickup
events.description_html:
Hey Joy Seekers! Want to naturally feel better? Nature calls, and she is one of the most natural ways on earth to heal yourself of many an ache. Be it psychological, or physical, Mother Earth is there each day with so many benefits just waiting to be seeped into our souls.

"Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt" ~John Muir

Sad but true, in this modern society of screens and rubber healed shoes, we have lost connection with good ole Mother Nature. That loss of connection seems also to have lowered our respect for her well-being as we see trash on the ground wherever we go.

"We have forgotten to be good guests, how to walk lightly on the earth as its other creatures do" ~Barbara Ward

So...What better time to reconnect than on Earth Day??? What better time is there to take a walk in nature? And what better way to show appreciation for our Mother Earth, than by picking up trash as we walk among the trees, grass, water and flowers of Spring?

What to do:
Step 1: Say, YES! to the meetup! to motivate the masses! (This should be my biggest meetup to date! As, wherever you are, you can participate!)
Step 2: Since we are still in health and safety mode for Covid-19, I would love for you to join me in spirit for Earth Day 2020 by grabbing a trash bag and heading out to your favorite trail or park. Or, maybe try a new trail you have never been to! As you walk and take in the beauty of nature around you, show Mother Nature some love, by picking up trash along the way. In the end, you will feel better not just in body, but in spirit and soul.
Step 3: Post a picture to this meetup of your experience, so we can all at least join each other virtually in the spirit and good cause of the day.

Stay Happy and Healthy my Friends!
Marianda

events.description_html:
Come yoga with me LIVE every Wednesday morning on Zoom:

Join URL: https://zoom.us/j/280710362

Mixed levels class. Beginners welcome.

This gentle flow will link breath with movement helping you to find a steady rhythm for your practice. We will begin with meditation and pranayama practices, move into some yummy seated stretches to ease into the body before standing for some strength and balancing postures.

~This is a donation based class, making yoga more accessible to all. No one is turned away for lack of funds. Donate what you can here:

Venmo: @Rachel-Goudey
PayPal: send to [masked] (please pay with "send money to a friend")

~Led by Rachel Jennine Goudey

Meet Rachel, Free Yoga SF’s lead instructor:

Hi Yogis!

I’m Rachel.

I am a holistic therapist and yoga instructor in the Bay Area, specializing in practices that integrate the whole person -- mind, body, and spirit -- to promote healing and wellness. Coming from a lifelong background in dance and a family of artists and musicians, I have always found movement and creative expression to be a vital part of emotional work and healing. In my studies and work in the mental health field for over 10 years, I have witnessed first hand how yoga and other practices that incorporate the whole being provide much more than just temporary symptom relief. These practices foster a deep a true understanding of your process to stimulate healing, helping you to move forward with strength, resiliency, and trust in yourselves to make healthy life choices, becoming more skillfully adept in your thoughts and reactions to life's challenges.

In classes and private sessions with me I guide you in mindfulness practices, meditations, and movement flows that tap into multiple facets of what it means to be human. My group classes are mixed level and meet each student where they are at while still challenging them to reach new heights of self-realization, acceptance, strength and flexibility, both on and off of the mat. I will push you to challenge yourself while also guiding you to listen to your body and intuition. I teach from a place of authenticity, passion and playfulness.

"Strength to show up, to be your authentic self, and be heard. Let yoga be a guide to get you there."

See you on the mat ♥
Om Shanti Shanti Shanti
Peace to all.

For questions please contact Rachel Jennine at:
racheljenninewellnessandyoga.com
or
[masked]

events.description_html:
In current times of lockdown, we all tend to focus on the negative, on what we can't do and wonder how we will get out of this situation.

In this new reality of self-isolation and social distancing we can still remain connected as an inclusive and meaningful community by taking the conversation to the on-line world.

Through ZOOM video conference, you are warmly invited into dialogue with others in discussing a different topic each week and exploring some deeper questions along the way.

In this safe, inclusive, casual, and accepting environment, dialogue is encouraged over debate as each person has opportunity to share from their own diverse perspectives and experiences.

Folks in this group enjoy going beyond small talk, reflecting both inward and outward, helping build pathways for more peace and understanding in the world... and your voice matters! No particular set of beliefs (or creed) is required to be a part of this community building activity. Diverse perspectives are welcome.

Whether to discover yourself amidst a community on a common journey, or to find meaning among new friends, there is room at the table for you.

Creating Connection Oshawa is part of a network of over twenty communities across Ontario committed to sharing authentic conversation, promoting meaningful activities and fostering holistic wellness practices.

Please visit our Products 4 Purpose online store (http://www.products4purpose.ca) to make a purchase (or leave a donation) that benefits our meaningful partner organizations, gifted artisans and local operations. Your support is gratefully appreciated!

People of every walk of life, culture, faith or tradition, participate in a myriad of connection groups, forming meaningful community within the reality of this welcomed diversity. As a result of this inclusive outlook, these communities are multi-faceted - expressing the inspirations, aspirations, wisdom, practices and blessing of all.

By welcoming and accepting people who identify as “more spiritual than religious”, those searching for meaning, and those with humanist or agnostic approaches to life, the collective Creating Connection experience transcends the sum of our individual ways of being.

By embodying the principle of unity in diversity, we discover that dialogue is enriched by individuals with different backgrounds and experiences - and even by viewpoints which are contrary. By building relationships of trust, we can facilitate inner peace and meaningful conversations in our inclusive communities. We are LGBTQ+ affirming.

events.name: Now Available ONLINE!: Laughter Yoga: Laughing for the health of it!
events.description_html:
Laughter at Blue Lotus: Learn to Live Life Laughing for the health of it The body heals with play. The mind heals with laughter. The spirit heals with joy. Laughter Yoga is a restorative aerobic exercise sure to brighten lighten and strengthen you on all levels, no matter what your abilities are! No yoga mats or poses - just your willingness to LAUGH!

Laughter Yoga reduces physical, mental and emotional stress simultaneously while building your immune system, increasing respiration, improving circulation, decreasing stress hormones - which reduce feelings of anxiety and tension. In a Laughter Yoga class, you will experience: Breathing, Clapping, Gentle Stretching, Playfulness, Laughter and Yoga Nidra. Practicing Laughter enhances memory, creative thinking and problem solving. You will be taught how to laugh for no (cognitive) reason, and you will see how that turns into genuine laughter as you laugh with others, having fun! $5 per session 🤗 Questions? [masked]. Cathy Grippi[masked]

BIO: After years of seeking relief from physical and emotional pain, Cathy Grippi discovered LaughterYyoga in early 2016. The effects were so profound, Cathy became a Laughter Yoga Leader in the spring of 2016, and became a Certified Laughter Yoga Leader Teacher in the summer of 2019, with Laughter Yoga International University. In the fall of 2019, Cathy became a Certified Laughter Leader with the World Laughter Tour. Cathy is am member of AATH, the Association of Applied and Theraputic Humor, where she is participating in their Humor Academy, which provides insight and more on how we can use humor in our daily lives - in productive ways.

In the winter of 2017, Cathy began Laughter in the Park, which continues each Saturday morning on Venice Island. Cathy has brought Laughter Yoga to assisted living and memory care facilities, mentally challenged young adult programs as well as summer camps for the general population. The opportunity to bring this unique exercise modality to Blue Lotus Meditation and Holistic Center provides the public with opportunities to experience this practice in a different way that is done outside in a park setting.

events.name: ONLINE: Prayer and Chant for All Beings
events.organiser: Dances of Universal Peace, Phoenix Area
events.description_html:
Dear Friends,

Blessings to you. Hoping you are keeping well and safe.

As you know, we suspended our Phoenix area circles for all of March. We will do the same throughout April. This message is an update, with information about what we are offering while we are not meeting in person.

We know that a primary measure to diminishing the spread of Covid-19 virus is social distancing, limiting our contact with others and especially groups. It’s important to be aware that physical separation does not mean spiritual separation. This circumstance may even provide greater opportunity for awareness of deeper spiritual connectivity.

It can be difficult to let go of a beloved practice such as dancing and praying together because of all that we desire to share this way. We may feel sad to consider going without this sharing in the face of the uncertainty we find ourselves dealing with. The support we find through community is vital to our sense of well-being.

So, we’re creating ways to celebrate our deeper connection in the Infinite even as we navigate these challenging times, a way to connect and to do practice, holding the intention to connect in community with heart and presence and to cultivate a healing influence for ourselves and others.

Find details below!

May All Beings Be Well
May All Beings Be Happy
May All Beings Be Safe,
Peace Peace Peace.

Rahmana and Shivadam, Phoenix Area Dances of Universal Peace

events.description_html:
Ok... new Covid-19 Friendly Meetup

Ok, I don’t love Zoom but it seems people are comfortable with the platform so we are using zoom for our first virtual meetup

But here is the good thing... your project can be as simple or as involved... take no room or take up lots of room... and can not smell at all or let your smelly freak flag flow...

This may work or may be a disaster but either way it will be fun

As a help, if when we are finally together again please make a donation towards the meetup charge.

Still no politics, no drama, no religion tho I do realize it is Good Friday but let’s try

I will text you zoom info once everyone is signed up.

Ok let’s see how it goes...

events.name: Brooklyn Crochet Connection Online Crochet Circle
events.description_html:
Join “Brooklyn Crochet” Connection Crochet Circle Online. Grab your project and let's socialize while we practice social distancing.

(This I a free event if you would like to make a donation to help keep the meetup site running; we won’t stop you ❤️)

events.name: Virtual Paint Party 4-22-2020
events.description_html:
Join us for a Virtual Paint Party on[masked] from 3-5:30 p.m. to join us, click in this link to pay for your seat: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=5NYUD4WZP7D7W

Paint in the comfort of your own home, Join our virtual paint party and have some fun. I will teach you step-by-step. The only tool you'll need are a few palette knives. You can do it!!!! You don't have to leave your home to have fun creating something new. The cost is only $25. Once you pay for your spot, you will receive an email with the link to the private FB group.

events.name: Crafternoons on Zoom!
events.organiser: Crafternoons on Zoom with Alex Makes Art
events.description_html:
Wednesday, April 22, 2020 Craft: Rock Garden!

Happy Earth Day!

Let's unload some of that rock collection of yours and turn stones into a cheerful succulent garden! Free of sharp spines and thorns. Once you register at alexmakesart.eventbrite.com, you will receive your materials list and the Zoom ID.

events.name: Virtual Knit Nite Please join us online!
events.description_html: Lets see what you're up to in Quarantine! Bring your crafts, drinks, food and messy hair.

events.name: VIRTUAL Knit Or Crochet Or Whatever
events.description_html: For the foreseeable future, we will be holding virtual gatherings via Zoom at our regularly scheduled times. I f you are interested in joining us, please RSVP to the event and then send a message to our group member Andrea Carvin through Meetup with your email address. She will then send you an invitation to join that meeting. You only need to send her your email once. Hope to see you soon! Linda

events.name: After work knit-up
events.description_html: Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we will meet online until further notice. Further info can be found in the comments section. Look after yourselves xx

events.name: Getting Knitty with it
events.description_html:
We want you all to stay at home to save lives, but we still want to see your faces every Wednesday.
Join us at 6pm on Zoom for an online NDK!

events.name: Let’s Talk Technology con David Tena, Fabcafé
events.description_html:
Let’s Talk son una serie de charlas que tiene la voluntad de acercarte al talento que tenemos en MOB, un hub de innovación con tres espacios de coworking en el centro de Barcelona.

Cada miércoles a las 18.00 te invitamos a conocer a uno de nuestros “mobbers” con una charla de 20 min y luego una ronda de preguntas. Las charlas giraran entorno a la innovación, tecnología, creatividad, y diseño de espacio.

Esta primera charla será con David Tena, CEO de FabCafé Barcelona, nos contará de primera mano las acciones que están llevando a cabo para ayudar a los hospitales de Barcelona y cómo están surfeando las dificultades para poder aportar su granito de arena a la lucha contra este virus.

Esperamos poder verte, escucharte y debatir juntos sobre cómo estas pequeñas acciones locales pueden tener un gran impacto en este combate global.

Inscríbete en Eventbrite y te mandaremos el link para la charla
https://www.eventbrite.es/e/entradas-lets-talk-technology-con-david-tena-fabcafe-103114422012
--

Let's talk is a series of talks that aim to bring you closer to the talent we have at MOB, an innovation centre with three coworking spaces in the centre of Barcelona.

Every Wednesday at 6pm, we invite you to meet one of our "mobbers" with a 20-minute talk followed by a round of questions. The talks will revolve around innovation, technology, creativity, and space design.

This first talk will be with David Tena, CEO at FabCafé Barcelona, ​​will tell us first hand about the actions they are carrying out to support hospitals in Barcelona and how they are navigating challenges in order to contribute their bit to the fight against the virus.

We look forward to seeing you, listening to you and discussing together how these small local actions can have a major impact in this global fight.

Register for the event in Eventbrite to receive the link on the day of the talk.
https://www.eventbrite.es/e/entradas-lets-talk-technology-con-david-tena-fabcafe-103114422012

This talk will be in Spanish.

events.name: 4th Wednesday: Advanced 3D Printing Techniques
events.description_html:
Take your 3D Printing Game a step further! Learn from others, share your experiences. Work with multiple processes, 3D Print on fabric, add LED lighting, and more!

This is a BYOD event. Please bring your laptop if you wish to participate.

Although we have allotted 3 hours for this class, we often finish early. You're welcome to leave at any time.

events.name: Knitting under the influence! (Ballard Beer Company)
events.description_html: Let's meet every other week at Ballard Beer Company. We have a standing reservation for this time, so if you're the first there, grab a beer and grab a spot at the big table downstairs! If that's full, we're upstairs.

events.name: Toxic Beauty: a National Canadian Film Day / Earth Day screening
events.description_html:
Join us on Earth Day for National Canadian Film Day! We have a free screening of the 2019 documentary Toxic Beauty.

Toxic Beauty is a documentary feature film with exclusive access to scientists, lawyers, advocates, regulators, politicians, a dynamic whistleblower, survivors and women who have lost their lives. It follows the class action lawsuit against Johnson&Johnson and the plaintiffs, personal stories of women fighting for justice in a race against time with this deadly disease.

Woven throughout the film is a human experiment. We document, as Boston University medical student, Mymy Nguyen, measures her chemical body burden from over 27 products. Scientists monitor her shocking results.

In the end, the film meets the companies and people who offer solutions and optimism for safer, toxicant free cosmetics.

Directed by Phyllis Ellis. 90 minutes

events.name: The Wandering Woolies Meetup
events.description_html: We each work on our individual projects while chatting and generally having a great time together. The leader will make a few short announcements and then there will be a Show N Tell where each member shows what he or she is working on.

events.name: Virtual Knitting Meetup
events.description_html:
Come joint us with your knitting needles or crochet hooks. We’ll keep this virtual zoom meeting going until it’s safe to meet in person again. We have show and tell as typical at 8 pm.

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/402241061?pwd=WFlueTlnTzJpWm5yRE02bWpzMXB5Zz09

Meeting ID:[masked]
Password:[masked]

📱💻 *FREE* Online English / Japanese Language Exchange =『無料』オンライン日英ランゲージ・エクスチェンジ
*Free talk language exchange between English and Japanese
*フリートークの日本語と英語のランゲージエクスチェンジです

This is a *FREE* online meetup that you can easily participate if you have a smartphone or a PC in a safe environment such as at home to prevent COVID-19.

We do video chatting by using the "ZOOM" app. "ZOOM Cloud Meetings" app (for Smartphone and Tablet PC) or "Zoom Client for Meetings" app (for PC) which you can get from the link below, App Store, or Google Play.
*You have to install the app, but you don't have to create an account.
*Please check the link below for how to use the "Zoom" app.

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 Flow

📱 Before this meetup

Apply on this page.
↓
Install the "Zoom" app.
↓
Check the following rules before the meetup.
- This meetup is held 40 minutes and stops automatically.
- Click "Zoom Link for Meetup" after the scheduled time.
- Each group is from 2 to 8 people.
- "Organizer" organizes only, don't talk in this meetup.
- Be sure to have a camera and a microphone.
- Video chat participation is required.
- We do not lecture on how to use smartphones, PCs or apps.
- Keep one person talking within 20 seconds.
- Cooperate so that all participants have the same chance to speak.
- Talk to people with a "Nickname".
- Help and respect each other for good communication.
- Prepare a short self-introduction (Nickname, Country of origin, City where you live) in advance.
- Think about the topic in advance and decide together what topic we will talk about.

📱 At the time of meetup participation

Click the "Zoom links for meetups" at the top to join.
*Use your name as you registered in "Meetup".
↓
Push the "Join Breakout Room" button.
*We invited you to join the breakout room
*Smartphone: Touch the screen of the Zoom app and a button will appear at the top left of the screen.
*PC: Button is at the bottom right of the Zoom app
↓
Start within 2-5 minutes.
Short self-introduction each other.
Decide together what topic we will talk about.
Start a conversation.
↓
Automatically ends after around 40 minutes.

📱 Feedback
Please give us feedback on getting better from the following link.
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf

＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝

新型コロナウイルス感染症対策のため、ご自宅等の安心な環境で、スマホやPCがあればどなたでも気軽に参加できる無料のオンライン交流会です。

交流会では『ZOOM』というアプリを使用しビデオ通話で行います。『ZOOM Cloud Meetings』アプリ (スマートフォンやタブレット端末用)『ミーティング用Zoomクライアント』アプリ（PC用）アプリは下記リンクや App Store、Google Play で入手できます。
※参加はアプリのインストールが必要ですがアカウントの作成は不要です
※"Zoom"アプリの使い方は下記リンクより確認ください

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 流れ

📱 交流会参加前

こちらのページの参加ボタンを押してください。
↓
『Zoom』アプリをインストール。
↓
交流会前に以下のルールを確認ください。
- 交流会は開始から約40分で自動的に終了します。
- 『Zoom Link for Meetup』はイベント開始時間後に押してください。
- 交流会は2名から6名のグループで行います。
- オーガナイザーは交流会の管理のみで参加しません。
- カメラとマイクを必ず用意すること。
- ビデオチャットでの参加が必須です。
- スマホ、パソコン、アプリの使い方の案内はしません。
- 一人が話す時間は20秒以内に留めること。
- すべての参加者が平等に話せるよう協力ください。
- 相手を「ニックネーム」で呼び会話することを心掛けましょう。
- 良いコミュニケーションをするためにお互い尊重し、助け合いましょう。
- 事前に自己紹介（ニックネーム、出身国、住んでいる街）を準備ください。
- 事前に話す話題を考え、何を話すか一緒に決めましょう。

📱 交流会開始時

一番上の『Zoom links for meetups』を押す。
*参加の際はMeetup登録の名前で参加すること
↓
『ブレイクアウトセッションに参加』ボタンを押す。
*オーガナイザーがブレイクアウトセッションに招待します
*スマホ: Zoomアプリの画面をタッチすると画面左上にボタンが現れます
*PC: Zoomアプリの右下にボタンがあります
↓
約3-5分後に開始します。
それぞれ短時間の自己紹介をしましょう。
それぞれ用意した話題を披露し、皆で話し合う話題を決めましょう。
話題が決まったら会話を始めてください。
↓
約40分後に自動的に終了します。

📱 フィードバック
今後の改善のため下記リンクからご意見をお願いします。
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf
