This is a *FREE* online meetup that you can easily participate if you have a smartphone or a PC in a safe environment such as at home to prevent COVID-19.

We do video chatting by using the "ZOOM" app. "ZOOM Cloud Meetings" app (for Smartphone and Tablet PC) or "Zoom Client for Meetings" app (for PC) which you can get from the link below, App Store, or Google Play.
*You have to install the app, but you don't have to create an account.
*Please check the link below for how to use the "Zoom" app.

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 Flow

📱 Before this meetup

Apply on this page.
↓
Install the "Zoom" app.
↓
Check the following rules before the meetup.
- This meetup is held 40 minutes and stops automatically.
- Click "Zoom Link for Meetup" after the scheduled time.
- Each group is from 2 to 8 people.
- "Organizer" organizes only, don't talk in this meetup.
- Be sure to have a camera and a microphone.
- Video chat participation is required.
- We do not lecture on how to use smartphones, PCs or apps.
- Keep one person talking within 20 seconds.
- Cooperate so that all participants have the same chance to speak.
- Talk to people with a "Nickname".
- Help and respect each other for good communication.
- Prepare a short self-introduction (Nickname, Country of origin, City where you live) in advance.
- Think about the topic in advance and decide together what topic we will talk about.

📱 At the time of meetup participation

Click the "Zoom links for meetups" at the top to join.
*Use your name as you registered in "Meetup".
↓
Push the "Join Breakout Room" button.
*We invited you to join the breakout room
*Smartphone: Touch the screen of the Zoom app and a button will appear at the top left of the screen.
*PC: Button is at the bottom right of the Zoom app
↓
Start within 2-5 minutes.
Short self-introduction each other.
Decide together what topic we will talk about.
Start a conversation.
↓
Automatically ends after around 40 minutes.

📱 Feedback
Please give us feedback on getting better from the following link.
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf

＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝

events.name: Practice Conversational Spanish Online - Beginner to Advanced
events.organiser: Free Spanish Speaking Drills - Online  (New Orleans)
events.description_html:
In this Spanish Drill we will work on interactive speaking activities. The goal is to help you gain confidence speaking and improve your Spanish pronunciation. We'll be running free sessions starting every thirty minutes for all proficiency levels. Zero experience with Spanish is required to participate in Drill.

AFTER YOU JOIN THE EVENT ON MEETUP...
In order to select your proficiency level and get your Zoom link, please register for the specific 25-minute time slot you want at https://beepboop.us/pages/book
You can book any time slot, even if it differs from the time listed in this meetup event.

WHAT IS SPANISH DRILL?
Spanish Drill is a speaking-focused, 25-minute long, online group language lesson. Each Drill is taught by a live Drill Instructor in a round robin style where students are kept on the edge of their seats as they’re guided through fun speaking exercises.

WHO TEACHES SPANISH DRILL?
All Drills are taught by live Drill Instructors who are native Spanish speakers. 80% of your Drill Instructors have received training at Dartmouth College in the Rassias Method of language education. They are Ivy League educated!

HOW MANY STUDENTS IN EACH DRILL?
Between 2-10 students

WHAT'S THE TOPIC OF EACH DRILL?
The VIP students in the class select the topic that the entire Drill practices. The topic could be anything from healthcare, politics, travel to romance. The only way to know the topic beforehand is to become a VIP. For more info on becoming a VIP visit https://beepboop.us/pages/vip

IS DRILL FREE?
Yes. Drill is funded by students who have more accelerated learning goals that require more speaking opportunities, more pronunciation correction, and the ability to practice specific topics.

HOW DO I GET MY ZOOM LINK?
1) Go to https://beepboop.us/pages/book and select “Click for free Drills”
2) Select your speaking proficiency level
3) Choose ANY 25-minute time slot on ANY day (we have Drills every night and you’re welcome to come whenever. Just don’t be greedy and book slots you will not attend!)
4) Once you register, you will receive a confirmation email from beepboop.us with the meeting link for your Spanish Drill under the “Location”

QUESTIONS?
Please read our FAQ https://beepboop.us/pages/frequently-asked-questions
If you still have questions, email me at [masked].
Sorry, I don't check messages sent within the Meetup app.

events.name: Wonder and Thunder Conversations
events.organiser: Women of Color in The Workplace® DC
events.description_html:
The entire network is invited to come together once a week at 11 AM Central ( 12 PM Eastern) for one hour to share until we get through the COVID-19 lock-down.

For some of us, the workplace has become our homes temporarily or indefinitely and for others, there may be no place of work. The future may be looking kind of shaky. In the coming week, let’s chat about it.

To get the most out of these sessions, you may want to turn your video camera on. There’s nothing like making a face to face connection.

In these conversations, we will share our experiences, what we are going through from day to day and grab tips and advice from one another.
What we individually have to offer is unique. Therefore, come as you are, don’t be shy, bring your unique thunder to Women of Color in the Workplace® conversations.

events.description_html:
Update 3/13: in an effort to do our part to help keep people safe, we are postponing our March book discussion and moving it to April 22. We apologize if this causes anybody any inconvenience.

For March, we'll read a sci-fi classic, Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? This book serves the basis for the movie Blade Runner.

https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/36402034-do-androids-dream-of-electric-sheep

It was January 2021, and Rick Deckard had a license to kill.
Somewhere among the hordes of humans out there, lurked several rogue androids. Deckard's assignment--find them and then..."retire" them. Trouble was, the androids all looked exactly like humans, and they didn't want to be found!

You can find us on Zoom:
Meeting ID:[masked]
Password: Sheep

events.name: The War of the Worlds (discussion 1)
events.organiser: NW Book Club for Curious Anachronistic Readers Of Literature
events.description_html:
With libraries closed and most bookstores selling by order only, we thought we'd pick something classic and widely available.

The War of the Worlds by H. G. Wells is one of the earliest depictions of a conflict between earthlings and extraterrestrial invaders. Its classic status was solidified by a 1938 radio reading that allegedly caused panic as listeners did not realize it was a fictional story - or maybe the panic was sensationalized by newspaper editors seeking to discredit radio?*

Either way, let's dig in to this one - does it resonate with us today?

Download a free eBook directly from Project Gutenberg or through your library, or seek a hard copy by mail or curbside pickup from your favorite local bookstore. Powell's has used paperbacks for as little as $2.95!

I'm limiting the number of participants to 10 again, so if you can't make it, please update your RSVP. Looking forward to talking to you all!

*(https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2013/10/30/241797346/75-years-ago-war-of-the-worlds-started-a-panic-or-did-it)

events.name: Virtual Meeting: April: 2020 Adaptations (+Tower of Dawn AND Kingdom of Ash!)
events.description_html:
UPDATE 4/19/20: To attend this virtual meeting, you will need to visit the link where it says "Online Event" and pre-register. After registering, you will receive an email confirmation. This registration website says Windermere--don't worry, it's the correct site! The registration asks for your name and email. We are doing this registration process so that we don't get people coming into the meeting who aren't invited (like Zoombombers). If you do not already have the (free) zoom app on your computer or phone or other video-enabled device, you should also download that before the meeting on Wednesday. Let me or Jamie DeHaven know if you have any issues getting into the meeting!

We decided to just postpone our discussion for the books we were going to discuss in March (2020 Adaptations) until this meeting in April, and also go ahead and finish our readalong of the Throne of Glass series, by discussing Tower of Dawn AND Kingdom of Ash. So we'll have four books to discuss at this meeting in April. As always, only read the ones you want to read!

Because it might be hard to find specific books these days, we are not having a theme for our May meeting, so you do not need to bring any suggestions to this April meeting. We will still meet for May, and still have books to read, but it will just be a little different.

I'm looking forward to this video chat! Here are our books for April (2020 Adaptations):

Tiny Pretty Things by Sona Charaipotra and Dhonielle Clayton
(This book has an upcoming Netflix adaptation.)

How far is too far?

At one of Manhattan's most elite ballet schools, wafer-thin ballerinas pull their hair into sleek buns and lace their pointe shoes high, waiting for their chance to shine. But beneath the pretty, polished surface, these girls are hiding some terrible secrets and telling some twisted lies.

Privileged Bette is tiny and beautiful—like a ballerina in a music box. But living forever in the shadow of her ballet-star sister and under the weight of family expectations brings out a dangerous edge in her.

Perfectionist June can turn a flawless plié and diligently keeps her weight below 100 pounds. But she's never landed a lead role. Tired of always being the understudy, this year she'll settle for nothing but the best—even if she must resort to some less-than-perfect means to get there.

And new girl Gigi isn't your traditional ballerina. A free-spirited California girl, she's not used to the fierce competition. Still, that doesn't stop her from outperforming every dancer in the school. But even she is hiding a ticking time bomb, and the very act of dancing just might expose her secrets to everyone.

Being a prima isn't all satin and lace; sometimes you have to play dirty. With the competition growing fiercer with every performance, and harmless pranks growing ever darker, it's only a matter of time before one small spark ignites . . . and even the best get burned.

Opposite of Always by Justin A. Reynolds
(A movie adaptation of this book is "In Development.")

When Jack and Kate meet at a party, bonding until sunrise over their mutual love of Froot Loops and their favorite flicks, Jack knows he’s falling—hard. Soon she’s meeting his best friends, Jillian and Franny, and Kate wins them over as easily as she did Jack.

But then Kate dies. And their story should end there.

Yet Kate’s death sends Jack back to the beginning, the moment they first meet, and Kate’s there again. Healthy, happy, and charming as ever. Jack isn’t sure if he’s losing his mind.

Still, if he has a chance to prevent Kate’s death, he’ll take it. Even if that means believing in time travel. However, Jack will learn that his actions are not without consequences. And when one choice turns deadly for someone else close to him, he has to figure out what he’s willing to do to save the people he loves.

Tower of Dawn & Kingdom of Ash (Throne of Glass #6 & 7) by Sarah J. Maas

I am not going to include a synopsis here in case of spoilers.

events.name: Postponed: Bad Blood by John Carreyrou
events.description_html: Come and enjoy dinner, drinks and/or appetizers and engage in this month's book selection discussion!

events.name: March Book Club Meetup: The Silent Patient by Alex Michaelides
events.description_html:
**THIS WILL NOW BE ON SKYPE! PLEASE CHECK YOUR MESSAGES FOR MORE INFO**

Alicia Berenson’s life is seemingly perfect. A famous painter married to an in-demand fashion photographer, she lives in a grand house with big windows overlooking a park in one of London’s most desirable areas. One evening her husband Gabriel returns home late from a fashion shoot, and Alicia shoots him five times in the face, and then never speaks another word.

Alicia’s refusal to talk, or give any kind of explanation, turns a domestic tragedy into something far grander, a mystery that captures the public imagination and casts Alicia into notoriety. The price of her art skyrockets, and she, the silent patient, is hidden away from the tabloids and spotlight at the Grove, a secure forensic unit in North London.

Theo Faber is a criminal psychotherapist who has waited a long time for the opportunity to work with Alicia. His determination to get her to talk and unravel the mystery of why she shot her husband takes him down a twisting path into his own motivations―a search for the truth that threatens to consume him....

events.name: For Whom the Bell Tolls by Ernest Hemingway
events.description_html:
In 1937, Ernest Hemingway traveled to Spain to cover the civil war there for the North American Newspaper Alliance. Three years later he completed the greatest novel to emerge from "the good fight", For Whom the Bell Tolls.
The story of Robert Jordan, a young American in the International Brigades attached to an antifascist guerilla unit in the mountains of Spain, it tells of loyalty and courage, love and defeat, and the tragic death of an ideal. In his portrayal of Jordan's love for the beautiful Maria and his superb account of El Sordo's last stand, in his brilliant travesty of La Pasionaria and his unwillingness to believe in blind faith, Hemingway surpasses his achievement in The Sun Also Rises and A Farewell to Arms to create a work at once rare and beautiful, strong and brutal, compassionate, moving, and wise.

"If the function of a writer is to reveal reality," Maxwell Perkins wrote Hemingway after reading the manuscript, "no one ever so completely performed it." Greater in power, broader in scope, and more intensely emotional than any of the author's previous works, it stands as one of the best war novels of all time.

events.name: [VIRTUAL]  📖🔍 B69 | MYSTERY
events.organiser: Fiction Addiction: Young Women Hooked on Books
events.description_html:
Put on your thinking trench coat and let's read some mystery books! 🕵️

MEETING LINK 👉 (COMING SOON)

// ANY Mystery
Pick up any mystery novel, read it, and be ready to share with the group! Any book, you say?? That's right! Whatever your heart desires! Here are some thought starters below.

CLOSED DOOR MYSTERY // And Then There Was One, Agatha Christie

MURDER MYSTERY // In the Woods, Tana French

SCANDINAVIAN NOIR // The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, Stieg Larsson

TREASURE HUNTING // The Da Vinci Code, Dan Brown

TRUE CRIME // I'll Be Gone in the Dark, Michelle McNamara

COZY MYSTERY // Her Royal Spyness, Rhys Bowen

FAMILY DRAMA // The Majesties, Tiffany Tsao

HARDBOILED // Long Bright River, Liz Moore

THRILLER // No Exit, Taylor Adams

YOUNG ADULT // Truly Devious, Maureen Johnson

PROCEDURAL // The Missing American, Kwei Quartey

SUPERNATURAL MYSTERY // Broken Monsters, Lauren Beukes

GRAPHIC NOVEL // The Green River Killer, Jeff Jensen

Have fun, read something new, and get in touch with your inner sleuth! Feel free to drop your book choice in the comments or ask for recommendations. 👇

events.name: VIRTUAL BOOK CLUB — The Black Company by Glenn Cook
events.description_html:
Our usual spot, BookBar, has decided to stay closed through April (at least). Doing our part to #FlattenTheCurve, we're going virtual for April. I'll send out a Zoom link to RSVPers a day or two before. You can download on pretty much any device. Laptops and tablets work great, phones work pretty well too.

If you need the virtual invite, send me a note.

---------------_______------_____------____----___--__-__-__-__-__-_--_--_-__-__

Some feel the Lady, newly risen from centuries in thrall, stands between humankind and evil. Some feel she is evil itself. The hard-bitten men of the Black Company take their pay and do what they must, burying their doubts with their dead. Until the prophesy: The White Rose has been reborn, somewhere, to embody good once more. There must be a way for the Black Company to find her... So begins one of the greatest fantasy epics of our age—Glen Cook's Chronicles of the Black Company.

events.name: There There Virtual Meetup
events.description_html:
There There by Tommy Orange is this year's "One Book, One Philadelphia." A signature program of the Free Library that promotes literacy, library usage, and civic dialogue by encouraging the entire greater Philadelphia area to come together through reading and discussing a single book.

Set against a backdrop of sacred traditions, historical violence, and the metropolis of Oakland, California, Tommy Orange's debut novel is "a comic vision haunted by profound sadness" (Louise Erdrich). A finalist for the 2019 Pulitzer Prize, There There is a multi-voiced epic of 12 Native characters whose contemporary lives intertwine across the urban landscape in ways they may not yet realize.

They're all headed to the Big Oakland Powwow, and toward a crescendo of sacrifice, unspeakable loss, and loving heroism. Hailed as an instant classic, There There is "funny and profane and conscious of the violence that runs like a scar through American culture" (The Seattle Times).

events.name: Virtual Meetup: The Other Einstein by Marie Benedict
events.organiser: Madtown Super Awesome Sisterhood Wine & Dine Book Club
events.description_html:
Hi everyone- I’ve decided to move this event out a few weeks, so the scheduled date is now Wednesday, April 22nd.

We will be trying our first virtual meetup in April! Here’s the Zoom info:

Time: Apr 22,[masked]:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting
https://umn.zoom.us/j/92201923150

Meeting ID:[masked]

Hope everyone is staying safe and healthy.

From Goodreads.com:

“ In the tradition of The Paris Wife and Mrs. Poe, The Other Einstein offers us a window into a brilliant, fascinating woman whose light was lost in Einstein's enormous shadow. It is the story of Einstein's wife, a brilliant physicist in her own right, whose contribution to the special theory of relativity is hotly debated and may have been inspired by her own profound and very personal insight.

Mitza Maric has always been a little different from other girls. Most twenty-year-olds are wives by now, not studying physics at an elite Zurich university with only male students trying to outdo her clever calculations. But Mitza is smart enough to know that, for her, math is an easier path than marriage. And then fellow student Albert Einstein takes an interest in her, and the world turns sideways. Theirs becomes a partnership of the mind and of the heart, but there might not be room for more than one genius in a marriage.”

events.name: Paul Kelly and Paul Grabowsky: Please Leave Your Light On
events.summary: Running Times: Doors - 6:30pm, Jess Hitchcock - 8:00pm, Finish - 10:30pm, *Please note all times are approximate and subject to change. Other than sharing the same moniker, Messrs. Kelly and Grabowsky are each regarded as the poet laureate in their chosen field - Kelly is counted amongst our most lauded wordsmiths while Grabowsky, our most noted note-smiths. Following a one-off performance at the bespoke arts space Ukaria in the Adelaide Hills, they concurred that this collaboration deserved further development. This performance will be feature works from their new album, taken mainly from Kelly's vast catalogue. Grabowsky, an astonishing musical polymath, draws from his extensive trove of musical knowledge, giving the original songs a fresh framework while never, never losing sight of Kelly's intent.

events.summary: Running Times: Doors: 5:30pm Start: 6:30pm Finish: 10:30pm *All times are approximate and subject to change. Heading the line up is Grammy Winners, Blackstreet ("No Diggity", "You Blow My Mind") in their first ever Australian & New Zealand shows featuring their incredible band, hitmakers Next ("Too Close", "Wifey"), Grammy Winners All-4-One ("I Swear", "I Can Love You Like That") in their first Aussie shows in a decade and for their first ever Kiwi shows, r&b singer and producer, Mario Winans ("I Don't Wanna Know") in his first ever shows on our shores and Renee Neufville, one half of the dynamic Zhané ("Hey Mr. DJ"). The line up is rounded out by local r&b legends, CDB ("Lets Groove", "Hook Me Up"). Hosting this spectacular trip down memory lane is none other than one of the voices of '90s R&B group 112, Q Parker. Fans can expect full sets from all acts and over 4 hours of live r&b magic. Made in the '90s is back and an absolute must for any lover of the old school.

When athletes are attempting insane stunts 40 feet in the air over a 75 foot gap, the weather conditions have to be perfect as the onset of rain, dew, wind or other factors could be fatal. That's why we are reserving one or more additional days (Sunday 28th February or Monday 1st March 2021 ) as possible alternative show dates in case we need to reschedule. When you buy your ticket, please make sure that you are available on the reserve days too in case we have to use them for a rescheduled show. If we do, there are no refunds.

events.summary: The 2020 NRL season will be impacted by the Government's directive that we suspend attendance by the general public at matches in Round 2 and until further notice. The NRL is working closely with clubs, states and the game's partners to address issues associated with the closure of matches to members and fans of the game (and other scenarios that may present). NRL Telstra Premiership games will be temporarily held from sale until further notice. We will provide our valued members and fans with updates as information about our approach comes to hand via NRL, club and state channels. Now, as much as ever, we value your constant support and understanding. Rugby league is known for its resilience and we know we will work through this together.
